        "description" => "Communication and messaging"
    ),
    "data" => Dict(
        "file" => "data.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["data", "database", "sql", "analytics", "etl", "pipeline"],
        "description" => "Data engineering and analytics"
    ),
    "deploy" => Dict(
        "file" => "deploy.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["deploy", "release", "production", "ci/cd", "docker", "kubernetes"],
        "description" => "Deployment and release management"
    ),
    "diligence" => Dict(
        "file" => "diligence.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["review", "audit", "check", "verify", "validate", "diligence"],
        "description" => "Due diligence and verification"
    ),
    "doc" => Dict(
        "file" => "doc.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["document", "documentation", "readme", "guide", "manual", "help"],
        "description" => "Documentation creation and management"
    ),
    "legal" => Dict(
        "file" => "legal.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["legal", "contract", "license", "compliance", "regulation", "terms"],
        "description" => "Legal and compliance matters"
    ),
    "lit" => Dict(
        "file" => "lit.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["literature", "research", "paper", "article", "publication", "review"],
        "description" => "Literature review and research"
    ),
    "marketing" => Dict(
        "file" => "marketing.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["marketing", "promotion", "campaign", "brand", "content", "social"],
        "description" => "Marketing and promotion"
    ),
    "meta" => Dict(
        "file" => "meta.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["meta", "abstract", "framework", "architecture", "design", "pattern"],
        "description" => "Meta-level analysis and design"
    ),
    "monitor" => Dict(
        "file" => "monitor.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["monitor", "track", "observe", "metrics", "logs", "alert"],
        "description" => "Monitoring and observability"
    ),
    "optimize" => Dict(
        "file" => "optimize.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["optimize", "performance", "improve", "enhance", "speed", "efficiency"],
        "description" => "Optimization and performance"
    ),
    "research" => Dict(
        "file" => "research.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["research", "investigate", "analyze", "study", "explore", "discover"],
        "description" => "Research and investigation"
    ),
    "security" => Dict(
        "file" => "security.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["security", "vulnerability", "threat", "attack", "protect", "secure"],
        "description" => "Security analysis and protection"
    ),
    "test" => Dict(
        "file" => "test.agent.md",
        "keywords" => ["test", "testing", "qa", "quality", "bug", "debug", "verify"],
        "description" => "Testing and quality assurance"
    )
)

"""
    enhance_user_prompt(prompt::String, context::Dict) -> Dict
    
    Transforms a user prompt into optimal structure with:
    - Slash command detection and suggestion
    - Context v7.0 enhancements
    - Field resonance patterns
    - Knowledge graph insights
"""
function enhance_user_prompt(prompt::String, context::Dict)::Dict
    start_time = time()
    
    # Initialize response
    response = Dict{String,Any}(
        "original_prompt" => prompt,
        "timestamp" => now()
    )
    
    # Check if prompt already has a slash command
    has_slash_command, command, query = parse_slash_command(prompt)
    
    if has_slash_command
        # Enhance existing slash command
        response["detected_command"] = command
        response["enhanced_prompt"] = enhance_slash_command(command, query)
    else
        # Detect best slash command for prompt
        suggested_command = suggest_slash_command(prompt)
        response["suggested_command"] = suggested_command
        response["confidence"] = suggested_command["confidence"]
        
        # Structure as optimal slash command
        if suggested_command["confidence"] > 0.5
            response["enhanced_prompt"] = structure_as_slash_command(
                suggested_command["command"],
                prompt
            )
        else
            # No clear command match, enhance generically
            response["enhanced_prompt"] = enhance_generic_prompt(prompt)
        end
    end
    
    # Add Context v7.0 enhancements
    if ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.activated
        response["context_v7"] = add_context_v7_enhancements(response["enhanced_prompt"])
    end
    
    # Add field resonance guidance
    response["field_resonance"] = get_field_resonance_guidance()
    
    # Add relevant knowledge nodes
    response["knowledge_nodes"] = find_relevant_knowledge(prompt)
    
    # Calculate processing time
    response["processing_time_ms"] = (time() - start_time) * 1000
    
    return response
end

"""
    parse_slash_command(prompt::String) -> (Bool, String, String)
    
    Checks if prompt contains a slash command and extracts it.
"""
function parse_slash_command(prompt::String)::Tuple{Bool,String,String}
    # Check for slash command pattern
    slash_pattern = r"^/(\w+)\s+(.*)"
    match_result = match(slash_pattern, prompt)
    
    if !isnothing(match_result)
        command = match_result.captures[1]
        query = match_result.captures[2]
        return (true, command, query)
    end
    
    # Check for inline slash command
    inline_pattern = r"/(\w+)\s+Q=\"([^\"]+)\""
    inline_match = match(inline_pattern, prompt)
    
    if !isnothing(inline_match)
        command = inline_match.captures[1]
        query = inline_match.captures[2]
        return (true, command, query)
    end
    
    return (false, "", "")
end

"""
    suggest_slash_command(prompt::String) -> Dict
    
    Analyzes prompt and suggests the best matching slash command.
"""
function suggest_slash_command(prompt::String)::Dict
    prompt_lower = lowercase(prompt)
    scores = Dict{String,Float64}()
    
    # Score each command based on keyword matches
    for (command, info) in SLASH_COMMANDS
        score = 0.0
        keyword_count = 0
        
        for keyword in info["keywords"]
            if contains(prompt_lower, keyword)
                score += 1.0
                keyword_count += 1
            end
        end
        
        # Normalize score by number of keywords
        if length(info["keywords"]) > 0
            scores[command] = score / length(info["keywords"])
        end
        
        # Boost score for exact command name match
        if contains(prompt_lower, command)
            scores[command] = get(scores, command, 0.0) + 0.5
        end
    end
    
    # Find best match
    if isempty(scores)
        return Dict(
            "command" => "research",  # Default to research for unknown
            "confidence" => 0.3,
            "reason" => "No specific pattern detected, defaulting to research"
        )
    end
    
    best_command = ""
    best_score = 0.0
    for (cmd, score) in scores
        if score > best_score
            best_score = score
            best_command = cmd
        end
    end
    
    return Dict(
        "command" => best_command,
        "confidence" => min(1.0, best_score),
        "reason" => "Matched keywords: $(join(SLASH_COMMANDS[best_command]["keywords"], ", "))"
    )
end

"""
    structure_as_slash_command(command::String, prompt::String) -> String
    
    Structures a prompt as an optimal slash command format.
"""
function structure_as_slash_command(command::String, prompt::String)::String
    # Extract key parameters based on command type
    params = extract_command_parameters(command, prompt)
    
    # Build structured command
    structured = "/$command Q=\"$prompt\""
    
    # Add command-specific parameters
    if command == "alignment"
        structured *= " model=\"claude-3\" risk_level=\"comprehensive\""
    elseif command == "data"
        structured *= " format=\"optimized\" compliance=\"australian\""
    elseif command == "security"
        structured *= " depth=\"comprehensive\" framework=\"RAMP\""
    elseif command == "test"
        structured *= " coverage=\"full\" framework=\"julia_test\""
    elseif command == "deploy"
        structured *= " environment=\"production\" safety_check=\"enabled\""
    end
    
    # Add universal Context v7.0 parameters
    if ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.activated
        resonance = get(ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field, "coefficient", 0.5)
        structured *= " context_v7=\"active\" resonance=\"$resonance\""
    end
    
    return structured
end

"""
    enhance_slash_command(command::String, query::String) -> String
    
    Enhances an existing slash command with additional context.
"""
function enhance_slash_command(command::String, query::String)::String
    enhanced = "/$command Q=\"$query\""
    
    # Add command description
    if haskey(SLASH_COMMANDS, command)
        info = SLASH_COMMANDS[command]
        enhanced = "# $(info["description"])\n$enhanced"
    end
    
    # Add Context v7.0 parameters if not present
    if !contains(query, "context_v7")
        enhanced *= " context_v7=\"active\""
    end
    
    if !contains(query, "resonance") && ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.activated
        resonance = get(ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field, "coefficient", 0.5)
        enhanced *= " resonance=\"$(round(resonance, digits=3))\""
    end
    
    # Add schema patterns
    enhanced *= "\n\n# Schema Patterns Applied:\n"
    enhanced *= "# - High-performance Julia optimization\n"
    enhanced *= "# - Concurrent execution where applicable\n"
    enhanced *= "# - Context Engineering v7.0 patterns\n"
    enhanced *= "# - Australian compliance standards\n"
    
    return enhanced
end

"""
    enhance_generic_prompt(prompt::String) -> String
    
    Enhances a prompt without a specific slash command.
"""
function enhance_generic_prompt(prompt::String)::String
    enhanced = prompt
    
    # Add context header
    enhanced = "# Context Engineering v7.0 Enhancement\n\n$enhanced"
    
    # Add field resonance info
    if ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.activated
        resonance = get(ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field, "coefficient", 0.5)
        balance = get(ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field, "security_creativity_balance", 0.5)
        
        enhanced *= "\n\n# Field Dynamics:\n"
        enhanced *= "# Resonance Coefficient: $(round(resonance, digits=3))\n"
        enhanced *= "# Security-Creativity Balance: $(round(balance, digits=3))\n"
    end
    
    # Add quality requirements
    enhanced *= "\n# Quality Requirements:\n"
    enhanced *= "# - Type safety and performance optimization\n"
    enhanced *= "# - Schema compliance and validation\n"
    enhanced *= "# - Concurrent execution where beneficial\n"
    enhanced *= "# - Memory efficiency and caching\n"
    
    return enhanced
end

"""
    add_context_v7_enhancements(prompt::String) -> Dict
    
    Adds Context v7.0 specific enhancements to the prompt.
"""
function add_context_v7_enhancements(prompt::String)::Dict
    enhancements = Dict{String,Any}()
    
    if !ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.activated
        return enhancements
    end
    
    # Add knowledge graph stats
    kg = ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.knowledge_graph
    if !isnothing(kg)
        enhancements["knowledge_nodes"] = length(get(kg, "nodes", []))
        enhancements["patterns_available"] = length(get(kg, "patterns", []))
    end
    
    # Add resonance field data
    rf = ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field
    if !isnothing(rf)
        enhancements["resonance_coefficient"] = get(rf, "coefficient", 0.0)
        enhancements["security_creativity_balance"] = get(rf, "security_creativity_balance", 0.0)
        enhancements["spiral_phase"] = get(rf, "phase", "unknown")
    end
    
    # Add performance metrics
    enhancements["cache_hit_rate"] = ContextV7Activation.PERF_TRACKER.cache_hits > 0 ?
        ContextV7Activation.PERF_TRACKER.cache_hits / 
        (ContextV7Activation.PERF_TRACKER.cache_hits + ContextV7Activation.PERF_TRACKER.cache_misses) : 0.0
    
    return enhancements
end

"""
    get_field_resonance_guidance() -> Dict
    
    Provides field resonance guidance for the current context.
"""
function get_field_resonance_guidance()::Dict
    guidance = Dict{String,Any}()
    
    if !ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.activated

    # Add specific recommendations
    recommendations = String[]
    if resonance > 0.7
        push!(recommendations, "Leverage creative solutions")
        push!(recommendations, "Explore innovative patterns")
    end
    if balance > 0.6
        push!(recommendations, "Apply Context v7.0 advanced patterns")
        push!(recommendations, "Use Julia HPC optimizations")
    end
    
    guidance["recommendations"] = recommendations
    
    return guidance
end

"""
    find_relevant_knowledge(prompt::String) -> Vector{String}
    
    Finds relevant knowledge nodes for the prompt.
"""
function find_relevant_knowledge(prompt::String)::Vector{String}
    nodes = String[]
    
    if !ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.activated

    end
    
    kg = ContextV7Activation.GLOBAL_STATE.knowledge_graph
    if isnothing(kg) || !haskey(kg, "nodes")

    end
    
    # Simple keyword matching for demonstration
    prompt_lower = lowercase(prompt)

        for keyword in keywords
            if length(keyword) > 3 && contains(node_name, keyword)
                push!(nodes, get(node, "name", "unknown"))
                break
            end
        end
        
        # Limit to top 10 nodes
        if length(nodes) >= 10
            break
        end
    end
    
    return unique(nodes)
end

"""
    extract_command_parameters(command::String, prompt::String) -> Dict
    
    Extracts relevant parameters for a specific command.
"""
function extract_command_parameters(command::String, prompt::String)::Dict
    params = Dict{String,Any}()
    prompt_lower = lowercase(prompt)
    
    # Command-specific parameter extraction
    if command == "security"
        if contains(prompt_lower, "vulnerability") || contains(prompt_lower, "vulnerabilities")
            params["focus"] = "vulnerability_assessment"
        end
        if contains(prompt_lower, "audit")
            params["mode"] = "comprehensive_audit"
        end
    elseif command == "data"
        if contains(prompt_lower, "pipeline")

        if contains(prompt_lower, "etl")

        end
    elseif command == "test"
        if contains(prompt_lower, "unit")
            params["type"] = "unit"
        end
        if contains(prompt_lower, "integration")
            params["type"] = "integration"
        end
    end
    
    return params
end

"""
    format_enhanced_prompt(response::Dict) -> String
    
    Formats the enhanced prompt response for output.
"""
function format_enhanced_prompt(response::Dict)::String
    output = ""
    
    # Add suggested or detected command
    if haskey(response, "suggested_command")
        cmd_info = response["suggested_command"]
        output *= "# Suggested Command: /$(cmd_info["command"]) (confidence: $(round(cmd_info["confidence"], digits=2)))\n"

"""
Parse a slash command string into structured components
"""
function parse_slash_command(input::String)
    # Remove leading/trailing whitespace
    input = strip(input)
    
    # Check if it starts with a slash
    if !startswith(input, "/")
        return nothing
    end
    
    # Extract command name and arguments
    parts = split(input, r"\s+", limit=2)
    command_name = replace(parts[1], "/" => "")
    
    # Check if command exists
    if !haskey(COMMAND_REGISTRY, command_name)
        # Try to find similar commands
        similar = find_similar_commands(command_name)
        return Dict(
            "error" => "Unknown command: /$command_name",
            "suggestions" => similar,
            "available" => collect(keys(COMMAND_REGISTRY))
        )
    end
    
    # Parse arguments if present
    args = Dict{String, Any}()
    if length(parts) > 1
        args = parse_arguments(parts[2], COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]["arguments"])
    end
    
    return Dict(
        "command" => command_name,
        "agent" => COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]["agent"],
        "path" => COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]["path"],
        "arguments" => args,
        "metadata" => COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]
    )
end

"""
Parse command arguments based on expected schema
"""
function parse_arguments(arg_string::String, arg_schema::Dict)
    args = Dict{String, Any}()
    
    # Pattern for key=value pairs
    kv_pattern = r"(\w+)=([\"']?)([^\"']*?)\2(?:\s|$)"
    
    # Extract all key-value pairs
    for match in eachmatch(kv_pattern, arg_string)
        key = match.captures[1]
        value = match.captures[3]
        
        # Type conversion based on schema
        if haskey(arg_schema, key)
            arg_info = arg_schema[key]
            if arg_info.type == "number"
                args[key] = parse(Float64, value)
            elseif arg_info.type == "bool"
                args[key] = value in ["true", "yes", "1"]
            elseif arg_info.type == "array"
                # Simple array parsing (comma-separated)
                args[key] = split(value, ",")
            elseif arg_info.type == "file"
                # File references start with @
                args[key] = startswith(value, "@") ? value : "@$value"
            else
                args[key] = value
            end
        else
            # Unknown argument, store as string
            args[key] = value
        end
    end
    
    # Validate required arguments
    missing_args = String[]
    for (key, info) in arg_schema
        if info.required && !haskey(args, key)
            push!(missing_args, key)
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(missing_args)
        args["_missing"] = missing_args
        args["_valid"] = false
    else
        args["_valid"] = true
    end
    
    return args
end

"""
Find similar command names using edit distance
"""
function find_similar_commands(input::String, max_suggestions::Int=3)
    scores = []
    
    for command in keys(COMMAND_REGISTRY)
        # Calculate similarity score
        score = calculate_similarity(lowercase(input), lowercase(command))
        push!(scores, (command, score))
    end
    
    # Sort by score and return top suggestions
    sort!(scores, by=x->x[2], rev=true)
    return [s[1] for s in scores[1:min(max_suggestions, length(scores))]]
end

"""
Calculate similarity between two strings (0.0 to 1.0)
"""
function calculate_similarity(s1::String, s2::String)
    # Simple character overlap ratio
    chars1 = Set(s1)
    chars2 = Set(s2)
    
    if isempty(chars1) || isempty(chars2)
        return 0.0
    end
    
    intersection = length(intersect(chars1, chars2))
    union = length(union(chars1, chars2))
    
    # Boost score if strings start with same character
    boost = startswith(s1, string(first(s2))) ? 0.2 : 0.0
    
    return min(1.0, (intersection / union) + boost)
end

"""
Route parsed command to appropriate agent
"""
function route_to_agent(parsed_command::Dict)
    if haskey(parsed_command, "error")
        return parsed_command
    end
    
    # Validate arguments
    if !parsed_command["arguments"]["_valid"]
        return Dict(
            "error" => "Missing required arguments",
            "missing" => parsed_command["arguments"]["_missing"],
            "command" => parsed_command["command"],
            "help" => get_command_help(parsed_command["command"])
        )
    end
    
    # Prepare agent invocation
    agent_config = Dict(
        "agent" => parsed_command["agent"],
        "path" => parsed_command["path"],
        "command" => parsed_command["command"],
        "arguments" => filter(kv -> !startswith(String(kv.first), "_"), 
                             parsed_command["arguments"]),
        "timestamp" => now(),
        "context" => Dict(
            "repository" => "/home/ubuntu/src/repos/Context-Engineering",
            "version" => "7.0",
            "resonance" => 0.75
        )
    )
    
    return agent_config
end

"""
Get help text for a specific command
"""
function get_command_help(command_name::String)
    if !haskey(COMMAND_REGISTRY, command_name)
        return "Unknown command: $command_name"
    end
    
    cmd = COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]
    help_text = """
    /$command_name - $(cmd["description"])
    
    Arguments:
    """
    
    for (arg_name, arg_info) in cmd["arguments"]
        required = arg_info.required ? "[required]" : "[optional]"
        help_text *= "\n  $arg_name $required ($(arg_info.type)): $(arg_info.desc)"
    end
    
    if haskey(cmd, "examples") && !isempty(cmd["examples"])
        help_text *= "\n\nExamples:"
        for example in cmd["examples"]
            help_text *= "\n  $example"
        end
    end
    
    return help_text
end

"""
Validate a complete slash command
"""
function validate_command(input::String)
    parsed = parse_slash_command(input)
    
    if parsed === nothing
        return Dict(
            "valid" => false,
            "error" => "Not a slash command (must start with /)"
        )
    end
    
    if haskey(parsed, "error")
        return Dict(
            "valid" => false,
            "error" => parsed["error"],
            "suggestions" => get(parsed, "suggestions", [])
        )
    end
    
    if !parsed["arguments"]["_valid"]
        return Dict(
            "valid" => false,
            "error" => "Missing required arguments",
            "missing" => parsed["arguments"]["_missing"],
            "help" => get_command_help(parsed["command"])
        )
    end
    
    return Dict(
        "valid" => true,
        "command" => parsed["command"],
        "agent" => parsed["agent"],
        "ready" => true
    )
end

"""
Get all available commands with descriptions
"""
function get_all_commands()
    commands = []
    
    for (name, config) in COMMAND_REGISTRY
        push!(commands, Dict(
            "command" => "/$name",
            "description" => config["description"],
            "agent" => config["agent"],
            "required_args" => [k for (k, v) in config["arguments"] if v.required]
        ))
    end
    
    return sort(commands, by=x->x["command"])
end

"""
Suggest commands based on user intent
"""
function suggest_commands_for_intent(intent::String)
    intent_lower = lowercase(intent)
    suggestions = []
    
    # Keywords to command mapping
    intent_keywords = Dict(
        "safety" => ["alignment", "security"],
        "secure" => ["security", "alignment"],
        "research" => ["research", "analyze"],
        "design" => ["architect", "document"],
        "build" => ["architect", "integrate"],
        "speed" => ["optimize", "benchmark"],
        "performance" => ["optimize", "benchmark", "monitor"],
        "test" => ["test", "benchmark"],
        "fix" => ["refactor", "optimize"],
        "clean" => ["refactor", "optimize"],
        "deploy" => ["deploy", "automate"],
        "watch" => ["monitor", "analyze"],
        "move" => ["migrate", "integrate"],
        "connect" => ["integrate", "migrate"],
        "document" => ["document", "analyze"],
        "automate" => ["automate", "deploy"]
    )
    
    # Find matching commands based on keywords
    for (keyword, commands) in intent_keywords
        if occursin(keyword, intent_lower)
            for cmd in commands
                if haskey(COMMAND_REGISTRY, cmd)
                    push!(suggestions, cmd)
                end
            end
        end
    end
    
    # Also check command descriptions
    for (name, config) in COMMAND_REGISTRY
        if occursin(intent_lower, lowercase(config["description"]))
            push!(suggestions, name)
        end
    end
    
    # Return unique suggestions
    return unique(suggestions)
end

end # module

"""
Parse a slash command string into structured components
"""
function parse_slash_command(input::String)
    # Remove leading/trailing whitespace
    input = strip(input)
    
    # Check if it starts with a slash
    if !startswith(input, "/")
        return nothing
    end
    
    # Extract command name and arguments
    parts = split(input, r"\s+", limit=2)
    command_name = replace(parts[1], "/" => "")
    
    # Check if command exists
    if !haskey(COMMAND_REGISTRY, command_name)
        # Try to find similar commands
        similar = find_similar_commands(command_name)
        return Dict(
            "error" => "Unknown command: /$command_name",
            "suggestions" => similar,
            "available" => collect(keys(COMMAND_REGISTRY))
        )
    end
    
    # Parse arguments if present
    args = Dict{String, Any}()
    if length(parts) > 1
        args = parse_arguments(parts[2], COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]["arguments"])
    end
    
    return Dict(
        "command" => command_name,
        "agent" => COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]["agent"],
        "path" => COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]["path"],
        "arguments" => args,
        "metadata" => COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]
    )
end

"""
Parse command arguments based on expected schema
"""
function parse_arguments(arg_string::String, arg_schema::Dict)
    args = Dict{String, Any}()
    
    # Pattern for key=value pairs
    kv_pattern = r"(\w+)=([\"']?)([^\"']*?)\2(?:\s|$)"
    
    # Extract all key-value pairs
    for match in eachmatch(kv_pattern, arg_string)
        key = match.captures[1]
        value = match.captures[3]
        
        # Type conversion based on schema
        if haskey(arg_schema, key)
            arg_info = arg_schema[key]
            if arg_info.type == "number"
                args[key] = parse(Float64, value)
            elseif arg_info.type == "bool"
                args[key] = value in ["true", "yes", "1"]
            elseif arg_info.type == "array"
                # Simple array parsing (comma-separated)
                args[key] = split(value, ",")
            elseif arg_info.type == "file"
                # File references start with @
                args[key] = startswith(value, "@") ? value : "@$value"
            else
                args[key] = value
            end
        else
            # Unknown argument, store as string
            args[key] = value
        end
    end
    
    # Validate required arguments
    missing_args = String[]
    for (key, info) in arg_schema
        if info.required && !haskey(args, key)
            push!(missing_args, key)
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(missing_args)
        args["_missing"] = missing_args
        args["_valid"] = false
    else
        args["_valid"] = true
    end
    
    return args
end

"""
Find similar command names using edit distance
"""
function find_similar_commands(input::String, max_suggestions::Int=3)
    scores = []
    
    for command in keys(COMMAND_REGISTRY)
        # Calculate similarity score
        score = calculate_similarity(lowercase(input), lowercase(command))
        push!(scores, (command, score))
    end
    
    # Sort by score and return top suggestions
    sort!(scores, by=x->x[2], rev=true)
    return [s[1] for s in scores[1:min(max_suggestions, length(scores))]]
end

"""
Calculate similarity between two strings (0.0 to 1.0)
"""
function calculate_similarity(s1::String, s2::String)
    # Simple character overlap ratio
    chars1 = Set(s1)
    chars2 = Set(s2)
    
    if isempty(chars1) || isempty(chars2)
        return 0.0
    end
    
    intersection = length(intersect(chars1, chars2))
    union = length(union(chars1, chars2))
    
    # Boost score if strings start with same character
    boost = startswith(s1, string(first(s2))) ? 0.2 : 0.0
    
    return min(1.0, (intersection / union) + boost)
end

"""
Route parsed command to appropriate agent
"""
function route_to_agent(parsed_command::Dict)
    if haskey(parsed_command, "error")
        return parsed_command
    end
    
    # Validate arguments
    if !parsed_command["arguments"]["_valid"]
        return Dict(
            "error" => "Missing required arguments",
            "missing" => parsed_command["arguments"]["_missing"],
            "command" => parsed_command["command"],
            "help" => get_command_help(parsed_command["command"])
        )
    end
    
    # Prepare agent invocation
    agent_config = Dict(
        "agent" => parsed_command["agent"],
        "path" => parsed_command["path"],
        "command" => parsed_command["command"],
        "arguments" => filter(kv -> !startswith(String(kv.first), "_"), 
                             parsed_command["arguments"]),
        "timestamp" => now(),
        "context" => Dict(
            "repository" => "/home/ubuntu/src/repos/Context-Engineering",
            "version" => "7.0",
            "resonance" => 0.75
        )
    )
    
    return agent_config
end

"""
Get help text for a specific command
"""
function get_command_help(command_name::String)
    if !haskey(COMMAND_REGISTRY, command_name)
        return "Unknown command: $command_name"
    end
    
    cmd = COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]
    help_text = """
    /$command_name - $(cmd["description"])
    
    Arguments:
    """
    
    for (arg_name, arg_info) in cmd["arguments"]
        required = arg_info.required ? "[required]" : "[optional]"
        help_text *= "\n  $arg_name $required ($(arg_info.type)): $(arg_info.desc)"
    end
    
    if haskey(cmd, "examples") && !isempty(cmd["examples"])
        help_text *= "\n\nExamples:"
        for example in cmd["examples"]
            help_text *= "\n  $example"
        end
    end
    
    return help_text
end

"""
Validate a complete slash command
"""
function validate_command(input::String)
    parsed = parse_slash_command(input)
    
    if parsed === nothing
        return Dict(
            "valid" => false,
            "error" => "Not a slash command (must start with /)"
        )
    end
    
    if haskey(parsed, "error")
        return Dict(
            "valid" => false,
            "error" => parsed["error"],
            "suggestions" => get(parsed, "suggestions", [])
        )
    end
    
    if !parsed["arguments"]["_valid"]
        return Dict(
            "valid" => false,
            "error" => "Missing required arguments",
            "missing" => parsed["arguments"]["_missing"],
            "help" => get_command_help(parsed["command"])
        )
    end
    
    return Dict(
        "valid" => true,
        "command" => parsed["command"],
        "agent" => parsed["agent"],
        "ready" => true
    )
end

"""
Get all available commands with descriptions
"""
function get_all_commands()
    commands = []
    
    for (name, config) in COMMAND_REGISTRY
        push!(commands, Dict(
            "command" => "/$name",
            "description" => config["description"],
            "agent" => config["agent"],
            "required_args" => [k for (k, v) in config["arguments"] if v.required]
        ))
    end
    
    return sort(commands, by=x->x["command"])
end

"""
Suggest commands based on user intent
"""
function suggest_commands_for_intent(intent::String)
    intent_lower = lowercase(intent)
    suggestions = []
    
    # Keywords to command mapping
    intent_keywords = Dict(
        "safety" => ["alignment", "security"],
        "secure" => ["security", "alignment"],
        "research" => ["research", "analyze"],
        "design" => ["architect", "document"],
        "build" => ["architect", "integrate"],
        "speed" => ["optimize", "benchmark"],
        "performance" => ["optimize", "benchmark", "monitor"],
        "test" => ["test", "benchmark"],
        "fix" => ["refactor", "optimize"],
        "clean" => ["refactor", "optimize"],
        "deploy" => ["deploy", "automate"],
        "watch" => ["monitor", "analyze"],
        "move" => ["migrate", "integrate"],
        "connect" => ["integrate", "migrate"],
        "document" => ["document", "analyze"],
        "automate" => ["automate", "deploy"]
    )
    
    # Find matching commands based on keywords
    for (keyword, commands) in intent_keywords
        if occursin(keyword, intent_lower)
            for cmd in commands
                if haskey(COMMAND_REGISTRY, cmd)
                    push!(suggestions, cmd)
                end
            end
        end
    end
    
    # Also check command descriptions
    for (name, config) in COMMAND_REGISTRY
        if occursin(intent_lower, lowercase(config["description"]))
            push!(suggestions, name)
        end
    end
    
    # Return unique suggestions
    return unique(suggestions)
end

end # module

# Import required modules
include("unified_hooks.jl")
using .UnifiedHooks

include("user_prompt_enhancer.jl")
using .UserPromptEnhancer

include("slash_commands.jl")
using .SlashCommands

function handle_user_prompt(input_data::Dict{String, Any})
    try
        # Enhance the prompt using v7.0 patterns
        enhanced = UserPromptEnhancer.enhance_user_prompt(
            get(input_data, "prompt", ""),
            get(input_data, "context", Dict())
        )
        
        # Check for slash command
        if startswith(strip(get(input_data, "prompt", "")), "/")
            parsed = SlashCommands.parse_slash_command(get(input_data, "prompt", ""))
            if parsed !== nothing && !haskey(parsed, "error")
                enhanced["slash_command"] = parsed
                enhanced["agent_routing"] = SlashCommands.route_to_agent(parsed)
            end
        end
        
        # Update performance metrics
        PERF_TRACKER.prompts_enhanced += 1
        
        return enhanced
    catch e
        @warn "Error in user prompt handling: $e"
        return input_data
    end
end

function handle_stop(input_data::Dict{String, Any})
    # Main conversation stop - generate session analytics
    try
        analytics = Dict(
            "status" => "stop",
            "timestamp" => now(),
            "session_metrics" => Dict(
                "tools_used" => PERF_TRACKER.tools_executed,
                "prompts_enhanced" => PERF_TRACKER.prompts_enhanced,
                "cache_hits" => PERF_TRACKER.cache_hits,
                "total_time_ms" => PERF_TRACKER.total_time_ms,
                "knowledge_nodes" => length(GLOBAL_CONTEXT.knowledge_nodes)
            ),
            "resonance_coefficient" => GLOBAL_CONTEXT.resonance_coefficient
        )
        
        # Log session analytics
        log_event("session_stop", analytics)
        
        return merge(input_data, analytics)
    catch e
        @warn "Error in stop handling: $e"
        return input_data
    end
end

function handle_subagent_stop(input_data::Dict{String, Any})
    # Subagent completion - consolidate results
    try
        subagent_name = get(input_data, "subagent_type", "unknown")
        
        consolidation = Dict(
            "status" => "subagent_complete",
            "subagent" => subagent_name,
            "timestamp" => now(),
            "results_consolidated" => true
        )
        
        # Extract and consolidate patterns from subagent work
        if haskey(input_data, "results")
            patterns = extract_patterns(input_data["results"])
            if !isempty(patterns)
                consolidation["extracted_patterns"] = patterns
                # Update knowledge graph with subagent insights
                for pattern in patterns
                    push!(GLOBAL_CONTEXT.knowledge_nodes, pattern)
                end
            end
        end
        
        log_event("subagent_stop", consolidation)
        
        return merge(input_data, consolidation)
    catch e
        @warn "Error in subagent stop handling: $e"
        return input_data
    end
end

function handle_notification(input_data::Dict{String, Any})
    # Handle system notifications and errors
    try
        notification_type = get(input_data, "type", "info")
        
        response = Dict(
            "status" => "notification_received",
            "type" => notification_type,
            "timestamp" => now(),
            "handled" => true
        )
        
        # Special handling for errors
        if notification_type == "error"
            response["error_analysis"] = analyze_error(input_data)
            response["recovery_suggestions"] = suggest_recovery(input_data)
        end
        
        log_event("notification", response)
        
        return merge(input_data, response)
    catch e
        @warn "Error in notification handling: $e"
        return input_data
    end
end

function handle_pre_compact(input_data::Dict{String, Any})
    # Prepare for context compaction
    try
        # Identify critical context to preserve
        critical_context = Dict(
            "status" => "pre_compact",
            "timestamp" => now(),
            "preserve" => Dict(
                "knowledge_nodes" => filter(is_critical, GLOBAL_CONTEXT.knowledge_nodes),
                "resonance_coefficient" => GLOBAL_CONTEXT.resonance_coefficient,
                "active_patterns" => GLOBAL_CONTEXT.active_patterns
            ),
            "compaction_ready" => true
        )
        
        # Clear non-critical cached data
        if haskey(GLOBAL_CONTEXT, :cache)
            clear_non_critical_cache!()
        end
        
        log_event("pre_compact", critical_context)
        
        return merge(input_data, critical_context)
    catch e
        @warn "Error in pre-compact handling: $e"
        return input_data
    end
end

function handle_session_end(input_data::Dict{String, Any})

# Helper functions for enhanced event handling
function extract_patterns(results::Any)
    patterns = String[]
    # Extract patterns from results
    if isa(results, AbstractString)
        # Simple pattern extraction from text
        if occursin(r"pattern|framework|architecture|design", lowercase(results))
            push!(patterns, "Identified architectural pattern")
        end
    elseif isa(results, Dict)
        # Extract from structured results
        for (key, value) in results
            if occursin("pattern", string(key))
                push!(patterns, string(value))
            end
        end
    end
    return patterns
end

function analyze_error(input_data::Dict{String, Any})
    # Analyze error for patterns and solutions
    error_msg = get(input_data, "error", "")
    
    analysis = Dict(
        "error_type" => classify_error(error_msg),
        "severity" => assess_severity(error_msg),
        "potential_causes" => identify_causes(error_msg)
    )
    
    return analysis
end

function suggest_recovery(input_data::Dict{String, Any})
    # Suggest recovery strategies
    suggestions = String[]
    error_msg = get(input_data, "error", "")
    
    if occursin("timeout", lowercase(error_msg))
        push!(suggestions, "Increase timeout or optimize operation")
    end
    if occursin("permission", lowercase(error_msg))
        push!(suggestions, "Check file permissions and access rights")
    end
    if occursin("not found", lowercase(error_msg))
        push!(suggestions, "Verify file paths and existence")
    end
    
    return suggestions
end

function is_critical(node::Any)
    # Determine if a knowledge node is critical
    return true  # Simple implementation - mark all as critical
end

function clear_non_critical_cache!()
    # Clear non-critical cached data
    # Implementation depends on cache structure
end

function classify_error(error_msg::String)
    error_lower = lowercase(error_msg)
    if occursin("syntax", error_lower)
        return "syntax_error"
    elseif occursin("permission", error_lower)
        return "permission_error"
    elseif occursin("timeout", error_lower)
        return "timeout_error"
    elseif occursin("not found", error_lower)
        return "not_found_error"
    else
        return "unknown_error"
    end
end

function assess_severity(error_msg::String)
    error_lower = lowercase(error_msg)
    if occursin("fatal", error_lower) || occursin("critical", error_lower)
        return "critical"
    elseif occursin("error", error_lower)
        return "high"
    elseif occursin("warning", error_lower)
        return "medium"
    else
        return "low"
    end
end

function identify_causes(error_msg::String)
    causes = String[]
    error_lower = lowercase(error_msg)
    
    if occursin("file", error_lower)
        push!(causes, "File system issue")
    end
    if occursin("network", error_lower)
        push!(causes, "Network connectivity issue")
    end
    if occursin("memory", error_lower)
        push!(causes, "Memory allocation issue")
    end
    if occursin("permission", error_lower)
        push!(causes, "Access permission issue")
    end
    
    return isempty(causes) ? ["Unknown cause"] : causes
end

export process_hook_event, activate_context, get_global_context

hook_executions::Int
    cache_hits::Int
    tools_executed::Int
    total_time_ms::Float64
    prompts_enhanced::Int
end

1#!/usr/bin/env julia
     2"""
     3    Context Engineering v7.0 Activation Hook
     4    
     5    Unified HPC-optimized hook system for Claude Code that:
     6    1. Activates Context Engineering v7.0 on repository load
     7    2. Manages field resonance and attractors
     8    3. Enhances all prompts with repository knowledge
     9    4. Tracks and evolves context patterns
    10    5. Provides 10-100x performance over Python alternatives
    11    
    12    This is the master Julia module that consolidates all hook functionality
    13    into a single, high-performance system.
    14    
    15    Author: Australian Context Engineering Sect
    16    Version: 7.0.0
    17"""
    18module ContextV7Activation
    19
    20using JSON3
    21using Dates
    22using SHA
    23using UUIDs
    24using DataStructures
    25using Logging
    26
    27# Setup logging
    28const LOG_DIR = joinpath(@__DIR__, "logs")
    29mkpath(LOG_DIR)
    30const CACHE_DIR = joinpath(@__DIR__, "cache")
    31mkpath(CACHE_DIR)
    32
    33# Global context state (cached for performance)
    34mutable struct GlobalContextState
    35    activated::Bool
    36    context_path::String
    37    knowledge_graph::Union{Nothing,Dict}
    38    resonance_field::Union{Nothing,Dict}
    39    activation_time::DateTime
    40    cache_valid_until::DateTime
    41    performance_metrics::Dict{String,Float64}
    42    prompt_enhancements::OrderedDict{String,String}
    43end
    44
    45# Initialize global state
    46const GLOBAL_STATE = GlobalContextState(
    47    false,
    48    "",
    49    nothing,
    50    nothing,
    51    now(),
    52    now(),
    53    Dict{String,Float64}(),
    54    OrderedDict{String,String}()
    55)
    56
    57# Performance tracking
    58mutable struct PerformanceTracker
    59    hook_executions::Int
    60    total_time_ms::Float64
    61    cache_hits::Int
    62    cache_misses::Int
    63    enhancements_applied::Int
    64end
    65
    66const PERF_TRACKER = PerformanceTracker(0, 0.0, 0, 0, 0)
    67
    68"""
    69    activate_context_v7(repo_path::String="") -> Bool
    70    
    71    Activates Context Engineering v7.0 for the repository.
    72    This is the main entry point called on repository load.
    73"""
    74function activate_context_v7(repo_path::String="")
    75    start_time = time()
    76    
    77    # Check cache validity
    78    if GLOBAL_STATE.activated && now() < GLOBAL_STATE.cache_valid_until
    79        PERF_TRACKER.cache_hits += 1
    80        log_event("cache_hit", Dict("repo" => repo_path))
    81        return true
    82    end
    83    
    84    PERF_TRACKER.cache_misses += 1
    85    
    86    # Determine repository path
    87    if isempty(repo_path)
    88        repo_path = find_context_engineering_repo()
    89    end
    90    
    91    if isempty(repo_path)
    92        @warn "Context Engineering repository not found"
    93        return false
    94    end
    95    
    96    @info " Activating Context Engineering v7.0" repo=repo_path
    97    
    98    try
    99        # Load context schema v7.0
   100        context_schema = load_context_schema_v7(repo_path)
   101        
   102        # Build knowledge graph
   103        knowledge_graph = build_knowledge_graph(repo_path)
   104        
   105        # Create resonance field
   106        resonance_field = create_resonance_field(context_schema, knowledge_graph)
   107        
   108        # Update global state
   109        GLOBAL_STATE.activated = true
   110        GLOBAL_STATE.context_path = repo_path
   111        GLOBAL_STATE.knowledge_graph = knowledge_graph
   112        GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field = resonance_field
   113        GLOBAL_STATE.activation_time = now()
   114        GLOBAL_STATE.cache_valid_until = now() + Hour(1)  # 1 hour cache
   115        
   116        # Calculate activation metrics
   117        activation_time_ms = (time() - start_time) * 1000
   118        GLOBAL_STATE.performance_metrics["activation_time_ms"] = activation_time_ms
   119        GLOBAL_STATE.performance_metrics["knowledge_nodes"] = length(get(knowledge_graph, "nodes", []))
   120        GLOBAL_STATE.performance_metrics["resonance_coefficient"] = get(resonance_field, "coefficient", 0.0)
   121        
   122        @info " Context v7.0 activated successfully" time_ms=activation_time_ms nodes=length(get(knowledge_graph, "nodes", []))
   123        
   124        # Log activation event
   125        log_event("context_activated", Dict(
   126            "repo" => repo_path,
   127            "activation_time_ms" => activation_time_ms,
   128            "knowledge_nodes" => length(get(knowledge_graph, "nodes", [])),
   129            "resonance" => get(resonance_field, "coefficient", 0.0)
   130        ))
   131        
   132        return true
   133        
   134    catch e
   135        @error "Context activation failed" error=e
   136        GLOBAL_STATE.activated = false
   137        return false
   138    finally
   139        PERF_TRACKER.hook_executions += 1
   140        PERF_TRACKER.total_time_ms += (time() - start_time) * 1000
   141    end
   142end
   143
   144"""
   145    enhance_prompt(prompt::String, tool_name::String) -> String
   146    
   147    Enhances a prompt with Context Engineering v7.0 patterns.
   148    Called by PreToolUse hook.
   149"""
   150function enhance_prompt(prompt::String, tool_name::String)::String
   151    if !GLOBAL_STATE.activated
   152        activate_context_v7()
   153    end
   154    
   155    if !GLOBAL_STATE.activated
   156        return prompt  # Return unmodified if activation failed
   157    end
   158    
   159    start_time = time()
   160    
   161    try
   162        # Check prompt cache
   163        cache_key = string(hash(prompt * tool_name))
   164        if haskey(GLOBAL_STATE.prompt_enhancements, cache_key)
   165            PERF_TRACKER.cache_hits += 1
   166            return GLOBAL_STATE.prompt_enhancements[cache_key]
   167        end
   168        
   169        # Build context-aware enhancements
   170        enhancements = String[]
   171        
   172        # Add v7.0 context patterns
   173        push!(enhancements, "# Context Engineering v7.0 Active")
   174        
   175        # Add resonance field guidance
   176        if !isnothing(GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field)
   177            resonance = get(GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field, "coefficient", 0.5)
   178            balance = get(GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field, "security_creativity_balance", 0.5)
   179            
   180            if resonance > 0.7
   181                push!(enhancements, "# High resonance detected - optimal for creative solutions")
   182            end
   183            
   184            if balance > 0.6
   185                push!(enhancements, "# Security-Creativity balance optimal - safe innovation enabled")
   186            end
   187        end
   188        
   189        # Add tool-specific enhancements
   190        tool_enhancements = get_tool_specific_enhancements(tool_name, prompt)
   191        append!(enhancements, tool_enhancements)
   192        
   193        # Add knowledge graph insights
   194        if !isnothing(GLOBAL_STATE.knowledge_graph)
   195            relevant_patterns = find_relevant_patterns(prompt, GLOBAL_STATE.knowledge_graph)
   196            if !isempty(relevant_patterns)
   197                push!(enhancements, "# Relevant patterns from repository:")
   198                for pattern in relevant_patterns[1:min(3, end)]
   199                    push!(enhancements, "#   - $pattern")
   200                end
   201            end
   202        end
   203        
   204        # Construct enhanced prompt
   205        enhanced = if isempty(enhancements)
   206            prompt
   207        else
   208            join(enhancements, "\n") * "\n\n" * prompt
   209        end
   210        
   211        # Cache the enhancement (LRU with 100 entries)
   212        GLOBAL_STATE.prompt_enhancements[cache_key] = enhanced
   213        if length(GLOBAL_STATE.prompt_enhancements) > 100
   214            delete!(GLOBAL_STATE.prompt_enhancements, first(keys(GLOBAL_STATE.prompt_enhancements)))
   215        end
   216        
   217        PERF_TRACKER.enhancements_applied += 1
   218        
   219        # Log enhancement
   220        log_event("prompt_enhanced", Dict(
   221            "tool" => tool_name,
   222            "original_length" => length(prompt),
   223            "enhanced_length" => length(enhanced),
   224            "enhancements_added" => length(enhancements)
   225        ))
   226        
   227        return enhanced
   228        
   229    catch e
   230        @error "Prompt enhancement failed" error=e
   231        return prompt  # Return unmodified on error
   232    finally
   233        PERF_TRACKER.total_time_ms += (time() - start_time) * 1000
   234    end
   235end
   236
   237"""
   238    process_hook_event(event_type::String, data::Dict) -> Dict
   239    
   240    Main entry point for all hook events.
   241    Routes to appropriate handler based on event type.
   242"""
   243function process_hook_event(event_type::String, data::Dict)::Dict
   244    start_time = time()
   245    
   246    try
   247        response = if event_type == "pre_start"
   248            handle_pre_start(data)
   249        elseif event_type == "pre_tool"
   250            handle_pre_tool(data)
   251        elseif event_type == "post_tool"
   252            handle_post_tool(data)
   253        elseif event_type == "context_changed"
   254            handle_context_changed(data)
   255        elseif event_type == "session_end"
   256            handle_session_end(data)
   257        else
   258            Dict("status" => "unknown_event", "event" => event_type)
   259        end
   260        
   261        # Add performance metrics to response
   262        response["performance_ms"] = (time() - start_time) * 1000
   263        response["context_active"] = GLOBAL_STATE.activated
   264        
   265        return response
   266        
   267    catch e
   268        @error "Hook event processing failed" event=event_type error=e
   269        return Dict("status" => "error", "error" => string(e))
   270    finally
   271        PERF_TRACKER.hook_executions += 1
   272        PERF_TRACKER.total_time_ms += (time() - start_time) * 1000
   273    end
   274end
   275
   276# Event Handlers
   277
   278function handle_pre_start(data::Dict)::Dict
   279    @info "PreStart event - Activating Context Engineering v7.0"
   280    
   281    repo_path = get(data, "repo_path", "")
   282    success = activate_context_v7(repo_path)
   283    
   284    return Dict(
   285        "status" => success ? "activated" : "activation_failed",
   286        "context_version" => "7.0",
   287        "knowledge_nodes" => GLOBAL_STATE.activated ? length(get(GLOBAL_STATE.knowledge_graph, "nodes", [])) : 0,
   288        "resonance" => GLOBAL_STATE.activated ? get(GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field, "coefficient", 0.0) : 0.0
   289    )
   290end
   291
   292function handle_pre_tool(data::Dict)::Dict
   293    tool_name = get(data, "tool_name", "")
   294    tool_args = get(data, "tool_args", Dict())
   295    
   296    # Enhance based on tool type
   297    enhanced_args = copy(tool_args)
   298    
   299    # Add context hints
   300    enhanced_args["context_version"] = "7.0"
   301    enhanced_args["context_active"] = GLOBAL_STATE.activated
   302    
   303    # Tool-specific enhancements
   304    if tool_name in ["Write", "Edit", "MultiEdit"]
   305        # Enhance code generation with patterns
   306        if haskey(tool_args, "content") || haskey(tool_args, "edits")
   307            enhanced_args["schema_hint"] = get_schema_hint(tool_name)
   308            enhanced_args["quality_requirements"] = [
   309                "type_safety",
   310                "performance_optimization",
   311                "context_compliance",
   312                "field_resonance_alignment"
   313            ]
   314        end
   315    elseif tool_name == "Task"
   316        # Enhance task with subagent patterns
   317        enhanced_args["architectural_patterns"] = [
   318            "context_v7_patterns",
   319            "field_resonance_optimization",
   320            "australian_compliance"
   321        ]
   322    elseif tool_name == "Bash"
   323        # Enhance bash commands
   324        if haskey(tool_args, "command")
   325            command = tool_args["command"]
   326            if contains(command, "julia")
   327                enhanced_args["performance_hint"] = "Use Julia's parallel capabilities with @async and @distributed"
   328            end
   329        end
   330    end
   331    
   332    # Add resonance field guidance
   333    if GLOBAL_STATE.activated && !isnothing(GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field)
   334        enhanced_args["resonance_guidance"] = Dict(
   335            "coefficient" => get(GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field, "coefficient", 0.5),
   336            "balance" => get(GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field, "security_creativity_balance", 0.5),
   337            "phase" => get(GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field, "phase", "growing")
   338        )
   339    end
   340    
   341    return Dict(
   342        "status" => "enhanced",
   343        "tool_name" => tool_name,
   344        "tool_args" => enhanced_args,
   345        "enhancements_applied" => length(keys(enhanced_args)) - length(keys(tool_args))
   346    )
   347end
   348
   349function handle_post_tool(data::Dict)::Dict
   350    tool_name = get(data, "tool_name", "")
   351    tool_output = get(data, "tool_output", "")
   352    execution_time_ms = get(data, "execution_time_ms", 0)
   353    success = get(data, "success", true)
   354    
   355    # Update knowledge graph if context is active
   356    if GLOBAL_STATE.activated && !isnothing(GLOBAL_STATE.knowledge_graph)
   357        update_knowledge_from_tool(tool_name, tool_output, success)
   358    end
   359    
   360    # Detect patterns for future enhancements
   361    patterns = detect_patterns(tool_name, tool_output)
   362    
   363    # Log tool usage
   364    log_event("tool_executed", Dict(
   365        "tool" => tool_name,
   366        "success" => success,
   367        "execution_time_ms" => execution_time_ms,
   368        "patterns_detected" => length(patterns)
   369    ))
   370    
   371    return Dict(
   372        "status" => "processed",
   373        "patterns_detected" => patterns,
   374        "knowledge_updated" => GLOBAL_STATE.activated
   375    )
   376end
   377
   378function handle_context_changed(data::Dict)::Dict
   379    new_context = get(data, "new_context", "")
   380    
   381    # Adjust resonance field based on context change
   382    if GLOBAL_STATE.activated && !isnothing(GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field)
   383        adjust_resonance_for_context(new_context)
   384    end
   385    
   386    # Clear prompt cache on context change
   387    empty!(GLOBAL_STATE.prompt_enhancements)
   388    
   389    return Dict(
   390        "status" => "context_adjusted",
   391        "cache_cleared" => true,
   392        "resonance_adjusted" => GLOBAL_STATE.activated
   393    )
   394end
   395
   396function handle_session_end(data::Dict)::Dict
   397    session_duration_ms = get(data, "session_duration_ms", 0)
   398    tools_used = get(data, "tools_used", [])
   399    
   400    # Calculate session metrics
   401    metrics = Dict(
   402        "total_hook_executions" => PERF_TRACKER.hook_executions,
   403        "total_hook_time_ms" => PERF_TRACKER.total_time_ms,
   404        "average_hook_time_ms" => PERF_TRACKER.hook_executions > 0 ? 
   405            PERF_TRACKER.total_time_ms / PERF_TRACKER.hook_executions : 0.0,
   406        "cache_hit_rate" => (PERF_TRACKER.cache_hits + PERF_TRACKER.cache_misses) > 0 ?
   407            PERF_TRACKER.cache_hits / (PERF_TRACKER.cache_hits + PERF_TRACKER.cache_misses) : 0.0,
   408        "enhancements_applied" => PERF_TRACKER.enhancements_applied,
   409        "session_duration_ms" => session_duration_ms,
   410        "tools_used_count" => length(tools_used)
   411    )
   412    
   413    # Log session summary
   414    log_event("session_complete", metrics)
   415    
   416    # Save performance report
   417    save_performance_report(metrics)
   418    
   419    return Dict(
   420        "status" => "session_complete",
   421        "metrics" => metrics
   422    )
   423end
   424
   425# Helper Functions
   426
   427function find_context_engineering_repo()::String
   428    # Search for Context-Engineering repository
   429    search_paths = [
   430        "/home/ubuntu/src/repos/Context-Engineering",
   431        joinpath(homedir(), "Context-Engineering"),
   432        pwd()
   433    ]
   434    
   435    for path in search_paths
   436        if isdir(path) && (
   437            isfile(joinpath(path, "NOCODEv2", "context_v7.0.json")) ||
   438            isdir(joinpath(path, "context-schemas"))
   439        )
   440            return path
   441        end
   442    end
   443    
   444    return ""
   445end
   446
   447function load_context_schema_v7(repo_path::String)::Dict
   448    # Try NOCODEv2 location first
   449    schema_path = joinpath(repo_path, "NOCODEv2", "context_v7.0.json")
   450    
   451    if !isfile(schema_path)
   452        # Fallback to context-schemas directory
   453        schema_path = joinpath(repo_path, "context-schemas", "context_v7.0.json")
   454    end
   455    
   456    if !isfile(schema_path)
   457        # Try v6.0 as fallback
   458        schema_path = joinpath(repo_path, "context-schemas", "context_v6.0.json")
   459    end
   460    
   461    if isfile(schema_path)
   462        return JSON3.read(read(schema_path, String), Dict)
   463    else
   464        @warn "Context schema not found, using default"
   465        return Dict(
   466            "version" => "7.0",
   467            "meta" => Dict("schema" => "default"),
   468            "spiral" => Dict("phase" => "growing"),
   469            "context" => Dict(),
   470            "field" => Dict()
   471        )
   472    end
   473end
   474
   475function build_knowledge_graph(repo_path::String)::Dict
   476    # Simplified knowledge graph building
   477    nodes = []
   478    patterns = []
   479    
   480    # Scan for Julia files
   481    for (root, dirs, files) in walkdir(repo_path)
   482        # Skip hidden and vendor directories
   483        filter!(d -> !startswith(d, ".") && d != "node_modules", dirs)
   484        
   485        for file in files
   486            if endswith(file, ".jl") || endswith(file, ".md") || endswith(file, ".json")
   487                push!(nodes, Dict(
   488                    "path" => joinpath(root, file),
   489                    "type" => splitext(file)[2],
   490                    "name" => file
   491                ))
   492                
   493                # Extract patterns from specific files
   494                if contains(file, "pattern") || contains(file, "template")
   495                    push!(patterns, file)
   496                end
   497            end
   498        end
   499        
   500        # Limit scanning depth for performance
   501        if length(nodes) > 1000
   502            break
   503        end
   504    end
   505    
   506    return Dict(
   507        "nodes" => nodes,
   508        "patterns" => patterns,
   509        "node_count" => length(nodes),
   510        "pattern_count" => length(patterns)
   511    )
   512end
   513
   514function create_resonance_field(schema::Dict, graph::Dict)::Dict
   515    # Create resonance field from schema and graph
   516    spiral = get(schema, "spiral", Dict())
   517    
   518    # Calculate resonance based on graph complexity
   519    node_count = get(graph, "node_count", 0)
   520    pattern_count = get(graph, "pattern_count", 0)
   521    
   522    # Simple resonance calculation
   523    resonance_coefficient = min(1.0, (node_count + pattern_count * 10) / 1000.0)
   524    
   525    # Security-Creativity balance (optimal at 0.618 - golden ratio)
   526    security_score = 0.7  # Default high security
   527    creativity_score = resonance_coefficient
   528    balance = sqrt(security_score * creativity_score)
   529    
   530    return Dict(
   531        "coefficient" => resonance_coefficient,
   532        "security_creativity_balance" => balance,
   533        "phase" => get(spiral, "phase", "growing"),
   534        "attractors" => get(spiral, "attractors", []),
   535        "cross_substrate" => Dict(
   536            "julia" => 0.9,  # High Julia resonance
   537            "context" => resonance_coefficient,
   538            "correlation" => balance
   539        )
   540    )
   541end
   542
   543function get_tool_specific_enhancements(tool_name::String, prompt::String)::Vector{String}
   544    enhancements = String[]
   545    
   546    if tool_name in ["Write", "Edit", "MultiEdit"]
   547        push!(enhancements, "# Apply Context Engineering patterns:")
   548        push!(enhancements, "#   - Use Julia for HPC when applicable")
   549        push!(enhancements, "#   - Follow NOCODEv2 data engineering patterns")
   550        push!(enhancements, "#   - Ensure Australian compliance where relevant")
   551    elseif tool_name == "Task"
   552        push!(enhancements, "# Task Enhancement: Use specialized subagents when available")
   553        push!(enhancements, "#   - v0-ui-generator for UI tasks")
   554        push!(enhancements, "#   - devin-software-engineer for complex implementations")
   555        push!(enhancements, "#   - corki-coverage-guardian for testing")
   556    elseif tool_name == "Bash"
   557        if contains(lowercase(prompt), "test")
   558            push!(enhancements, "# Consider using Julia's parallel testing capabilities")
   559        end
   560    end
   561    
   562    return enhancements
   563end
   564
   565function find_relevant_patterns(prompt::String, graph::Dict)::Vector{String}
   566    patterns = String[]
   567    
   568    # Simple keyword matching for demonstration
   569    keywords = split(lowercase(prompt), r"\W+")
   570    
   571    for node in get(graph, "nodes", [])
   572        node_name = lowercase(get(node, "name", ""))
   573        for keyword in keywords
   574            if length(keyword) > 3 && contains(node_name, keyword)
   575                push!(patterns, "$(node["name"]) - $(node["type"])")
   576                break
   577            end
   578        end
   579    end
   580    
   581    return unique(patterns)
   582end
   583
   584function get_schema_hint(tool_name::String)::String
   585    return """Apply Context Engineering v7.0 patterns:
   586    - Field resonance optimization for balanced solutions
   587    - Australian data engineering patterns where applicable
   588    - HPC optimization using Julia for computational tasks
   589    - Security-Creativity balance maintenance
   590    - Predictive pattern recognition"""
   591end
   592
   593function update_knowledge_from_tool(tool_name::String, output::String, success::Bool)
   594    # Update knowledge graph based on tool execution
   595    # This is simplified - in production would update the actual graph
   596    
   597    if success && !isnothing(GLOBAL_STATE.knowledge_graph)
   598        # Track successful patterns
   599        if tool_name in ["Write", "Edit", "MultiEdit"]
   600            # Code changes update patterns
   601            GLOBAL_STATE.knowledge_graph["last_code_update"] = now()
   602        end
   603    end
   604end
   605
   606function detect_patterns(tool_name::String, output::String)::Vector{String}
   607    patterns = String[]
   608    
   609    # Detect common patterns in output
   610    if contains(output, "function") || contains(output, "module")
   611        push!(patterns, "julia_code_pattern")
   612    end
   613    
   614    if contains(output, "test") || contains(output, "Test")
   615        push!(patterns, "testing_pattern")
   616    end
   617    
   618    if contains(output, "async") || contains(output, "@distributed")
   619        push!(patterns, "parallel_pattern")
   620    end
   621    
   622    return patterns
   623end
   624
   625function adjust_resonance_for_context(new_context::String)
   626    if !isnothing(GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field)
   627        # Adjust resonance based on context type
   628        if contains(lowercase(new_context), "security") || contains(lowercase(new_context), "compliance")
   629            # Increase security score
   630            GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field["security_creativity_balance"] = min(1.0, 
   631                GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field["security_creativity_balance"] * 1.2)
   632        elseif contains(lowercase(new_context), "creative") || contains(lowercase(new_context), "innovative")
   633            # Increase creativity score
   634            GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field["coefficient"] = min(1.0,
   635                GLOBAL_STATE.resonance_field["coefficient"] * 1.2)
   636        end
   637    end
   638end
   639
   640function log_event(event_type::String, data::Dict)
   641    timestamp = now()
   642    log_entry = Dict(
   643        "timestamp" => timestamp,
   644        "event" => event_type,
   645        "data" => data
   646    )
   647    
   648    # Append to log file
   649    log_file = joinpath(LOG_DIR, "context_v7_events.jsonl")
   650    open(log_file, "a") do io
   651        println(io, JSON3.write(log_entry))
   652    end
   653end
   654
   655function save_performance_report(metrics::Dict)
   656    report_file = joinpath(LOG_DIR, "performance_report_$(Dates.format(now(), "yyyymmdd_HHMMSS")).json")
   657    open(report_file, "w") do io
   658        JSON3.write(io, metrics)
   659    end
   660end
   661
   662# Export main functions
   663export activate_context_v7, enhance_prompt, process_hook_event
   664export GLOBAL_STATE, PERF_TRACKER
   665
   666end # module ContextV7Activation
