"""
Parse a slash command string into structured components
"""
function parse_slash_command(input::String)
    # Remove leading/trailing whitespace
    input = strip(input)
    
    # Check if it starts with a slash
    if !startswith(input, "/")
        return nothing
    end
    
    # Extract command name and arguments
    parts = split(input, r"\s+", limit=2)
    command_name = replace(parts[1], "/" => "")
    
    # Check if command exists
    if !haskey(COMMAND_REGISTRY, command_name)
        # Try to find similar commands
        similar = find_similar_commands(command_name)
        return Dict(
            "error" => "Unknown command: /$command_name",
            "suggestions" => similar,
            "available" => collect(keys(COMMAND_REGISTRY))
        )
    end
    
    # Parse arguments if present
    args = Dict{String, Any}()
    if length(parts) > 1
        args = parse_arguments(parts[2], COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]["arguments"])
    end
    
    return Dict(
        "command" => command_name,
        "agent" => COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]["agent"],
        "path" => COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]["path"],
        "arguments" => args,
        "metadata" => COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]
    )
end

"""
Parse command arguments based on expected schema
"""
function parse_arguments(arg_string::AbstractString, arg_schema::Dict)
    args = Dict{String, Any}()
    
    # Pattern for key=value pairs
    kv_pattern = r"(\w+)=([\"']?)([^\"']*?)\2(?:\s|$)"
    
    # Extract all key-value pairs
    for match in eachmatch(kv_pattern, arg_string)
        key = match.captures[1]
        value = match.captures[3]
        
        # Type conversion based on schema
        if haskey(arg_schema, key)
            arg_info = arg_schema[key]
            if arg_info.type == "number"
                args[key] = parse(Float64, value)
            elseif arg_info.type == "bool"
                args[key] = value in ["true", "yes", "1"]
            elseif arg_info.type == "array"
                # Simple array parsing (comma-separated)
                args[key] = split(value, ",")
            elseif arg_info.type == "file"
                # File references start with @
                args[key] = startswith(value, "@") ? value : "@$value"
            else
                args[key] = value
            end
        else
            # Unknown argument, store as string
            args[key] = value
        end
    end
    
    # Validate required arguments
    missing_args = String[]
    for (key, info) in arg_schema
        if info.required && !haskey(args, key)
            push!(missing_args, key)
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(missing_args)
        args["_missing"] = missing_args
        args["_valid"] = false
    else
        args["_valid"] = true
    end
    
    return args
end

"""
Find similar command names using edit distance
"""
function find_similar_commands(input::String, max_suggestions::Int=3)
    scores = []
    
    for command in keys(COMMAND_REGISTRY)
        # Calculate similarity score
        score = calculate_similarity(lowercase(input), lowercase(command))
        push!(scores, (command, score))
    end
    
    # Sort by score and return top suggestions
    sort!(scores, by=x->x[2], rev=true)
    return [s[1] for s in scores[1:min(max_suggestions, length(scores))]]
end

"""
Calculate similarity between two strings (0.0 to 1.0)
"""
function calculate_similarity(s1::String, s2::String)
    # Simple character overlap ratio
    chars1 = Set(s1)
    chars2 = Set(s2)
    
    if isempty(chars1) || isempty(chars2)
        return 0.0
    end
    
    intersection = length(intersect(chars1, chars2))
    union = length(union(chars1, chars2))
    
    # Boost score if strings start with same character
    boost = startswith(s1, string(first(s2))) ? 0.2 : 0.0
    
    return min(1.0, (intersection / union) + boost)
end

"""
Route parsed command to appropriate agent
"""
function route_to_agent(parsed_command::Dict)
    if haskey(parsed_command, "error")
        return parsed_command
    end
    
    # Validate arguments
    if !parsed_command["arguments"]["_valid"]
        return Dict(
            "error" => "Missing required arguments",
            "missing" => parsed_command["arguments"]["_missing"],
            "command" => parsed_command["command"],
            "help" => get_command_help(parsed_command["command"])
        )
    end
    
    # Prepare agent invocation
    agent_config = Dict(
        "agent" => parsed_command["agent"],
        "path" => parsed_command["path"],
        "command" => parsed_command["command"],
        "arguments" => filter(kv -> !startswith(String(kv.first), "_"), 
                             parsed_command["arguments"]),
        "timestamp" => now(),
        "context" => Dict(
            "repository" => "/home/ubuntu/src/repos/Context-Engineering",
            "version" => "7.0",
            "resonance" => 0.75
        )
    )
    
    return agent_config
end

"""
Get help text for a specific command
"""
function get_command_help(command_name::String)
    if !haskey(COMMAND_REGISTRY, command_name)
        return "Unknown command: $command_name"
    end
    
    cmd = COMMAND_REGISTRY[command_name]
    help_text = """
    /$command_name - $(cmd["description"])
    
    Arguments:
    """
    
    for (arg_name, arg_info) in cmd["arguments"]
        required = arg_info.required ? "[required]" : "[optional]"
        help_text *= "\n  $arg_name $required ($(arg_info.type)): $(arg_info.desc)"
    end
    
    if haskey(cmd, "examples") && !isempty(cmd["examples"])
        help_text *= "\n\nExamples:"
        for example in cmd["examples"]
            help_text *= "\n  $example"
        end
    end
    
    return help_text
end

"""
Validate a complete slash command
"""
function validate_command(input::String)
    parsed = parse_slash_command(input)
    
    if parsed === nothing
        return Dict(
            "valid" => false,
            "error" => "Not a slash command (must start with /)"
        )
    end
    
    if haskey(parsed, "error")
        return Dict(
            "valid" => false,
            "error" => parsed["error"],
            "suggestions" => get(parsed, "suggestions", [])
        )
    end
    
    if !parsed["arguments"]["_valid"]
        return Dict(
            "valid" => false,
            "error" => "Missing required arguments",
            "missing" => parsed["arguments"]["_missing"],
            "help" => get_command_help(parsed["command"])
        )
    end
    
    return Dict(
        "valid" => true,
        "command" => parsed["command"],
        "agent" => parsed["agent"],
        "ready" => true
    )
end

"""
Get all available commands with descriptions
"""
function get_all_commands()
    commands = []
    
    for (name, config) in COMMAND_REGISTRY
        push!(commands, Dict(
            "command" => "/$name",
            "description" => config["description"],
            "agent" => config["agent"],
            "required_args" => [k for (k, v) in config["arguments"] if v.required]
        ))
    end
    
    return sort(commands, by=x->x["command"])
end

"""
Suggest commands based on user intent
"""
function suggest_commands_for_intent(intent::String)
    intent_lower = lowercase(intent)
    suggestions = []
    
    # Keywords to command mapping
    intent_keywords = Dict(
        "safety" => ["alignment", "security"],
        "secure" => ["security", "alignment"],
        "research" => ["research", "analyze"],
        "design" => ["architect", "document"],
        "build" => ["architect", "integrate"],
        "speed" => ["optimize", "benchmark"],
        "performance" => ["optimize", "benchmark", "monitor"],
        "test" => ["test", "benchmark"],
        "fix" => ["refactor", "optimize"],
        "clean" => ["refactor", "optimize"],
        "deploy" => ["deploy", "automate"],
        "watch" => ["monitor", "analyze"],
        "move" => ["migrate", "integrate"],
        "connect" => ["integrate", "migrate"],
        "document" => ["document", "analyze"],
        "automate" => ["automate", "deploy"]
    )
    
    # Find matching commands based on keywords
    for (keyword, commands) in intent_keywords
        if occursin(keyword, intent_lower)
            for cmd in commands
                if haskey(COMMAND_REGISTRY, cmd)
                    push!(suggestions, cmd)
                end
            end
        end
    end
    
    # Also check command descriptions
    for (name, config) in COMMAND_REGISTRY
        if occursin(intent_lower, lowercase(config["description"]))
            push!(suggestions, name)
        end
    end
    
    # Return unique suggestions
    return unique(suggestions)
end

end # module

#!/bin/bash
#
# Test Script for AIO Meta-Agent Routing System
# Tests natural language to agent routing capabilities

set -e

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo -e "${BLUE}${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}         AIO Meta-Agent Routing Test Suite${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}${NC}"
echo

# Test function for Julia AIO module
test_aio_routing() {
    local query="$1"
    local expected_agent="$2"
    local description="$3"
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Testing: $description${NC}"
    echo -e "  Query: \"$query\""
    
    # Run Julia test
    result=$(julia -e "
        include(\"$HOME/.claude/hooks/context_engineering/aio_meta_agent.jl\")
        using .AIOMetaAgent
        using JSON3
        
        result = process_aio_query(\"$query\")
        println(JSON3.write(result))
    " 2>&1 || true)
    
    if echo "$result" | jq . >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        # Extract agent and command
        agent=$(echo "$result" | jq -r '.agent // "unknown"')
        command=$(echo "$result" | jq -r '.command // "none"')
        confidence=$(echo "$result" | jq -r '.confidence // 0')
        
        echo -e "  Routed to: ${CYAN}$agent${NC}"
        echo -e "  Command: $command"
        echo -e "  Confidence: $confidence"
        
        if [ "$agent" = "$expected_agent" ]; then
            echo -e "  ${GREEN} Correct routing${NC}"
            return 0
        else
            echo -e "  ${RED} Expected: $expected_agent, Got: $agent${NC}"
            return 1
        fi
    else
        echo -e "  ${RED} Failed to process query${NC}"
        echo "  Error: $result"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Counter for passed/failed tests
PASSED=0
FAILED=0

echo -e "${BLUE}Running AIO Routing Tests...${NC}"
echo

# Test 1: Simple optimization query
if test_aio_routing \
    "make my Python code run faster" \
    "optimize" \
    "Simple optimization request"; then
    ((PASSED++))
else
    ((FAILED++))
fi
echo

# Test 2: Security analysis query
if test_aio_routing \
    "check if my code is secure" \
    "security" \
    "Security analysis request"; then
    ((PASSED++))
else
    ((FAILED++))
fi
echo

# Test 3: Research query
if test_aio_routing \
    "help me understand how async programming works" \
    "research" \
    "Research and learning request"; then
    ((PASSED++))
else
    ((FAILED++))
fi
echo

# Test 4: Testing query
if test_aio_routing \
    "write unit tests for my functions" \
    "test" \
    "Test creation request"; then
    ((PASSED++))
else
    ((FAILED++))
fi
echo

# Test 5: Documentation query
if test_aio_routing \
    "create documentation for my API" \
    "doc" \
    "Documentation generation request"; then
    ((PASSED++))
else
    ((FAILED++))
fi
echo

# Test 6: Multi-agent query
if test_aio_routing \
    "research security issues and create tests" \
    "meta" \
    "Multi-agent orchestration request"; then
    ((PASSED++))
else
    ((FAILED++))
fi
echo

# Test 7: Deployment query
if test_aio_routing \
    "deploy my application to production" \
    "deploy" \
    "Deployment request"; then
    ((PASSED++))
else
    ((FAILED++))
fi
echo

# Test 8: Monitoring query
if test_aio_routing \
    "set up monitoring and alerts" \
    "monitor" \
    "Monitoring setup request"; then
    ((PASSED++))
else
    ((FAILED++))
fi
echo

# Test 9: Data processing query
if test_aio_routing \
    "process and analyze this data" \
    "data" \
    "Data processing request"; then
    ((PASSED++))
else
    ((FAILED++))
fi
echo

# Test 10: Ambiguous query (should default to research)
if test_aio_routing \
    "I need help with something" \
    "research" \
    "Ambiguous query (fallback test)"; then
    ((PASSED++))
else
    ((FAILED++))
fi
echo

# Display results
echo -e "${BLUE}${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}                    Test Results${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}${NC}"
echo
echo -e "  ${GREEN}Passed: $PASSED${NC}"
echo -e "  ${RED}Failed: $FAILED${NC}"
echo

if [ $FAILED -eq 0 ]; then
    echo -e "${GREEN} All AIO routing tests passed!${NC}"
    echo
    echo " The AIO meta-agent is ready to use!"
    echo
    echo "Example usage:"
    echo "  /aio make my code faster"
    echo "  /aio help me understand this error"
    echo "  /aio write tests and documentation"
    echo
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}  Some tests failed. Review the routing logic.${NC}"
fi

# Show example of actual hook integration
echo -e "${BLUE}${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}              Testing Hook Integration${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}${NC}"
echo

# Test with actual hook system
echo "Testing AIO with hook system..."
test_query='{"event": "user_prompt_submit", "prompt": "/aio make my Python code run faster", "context": {}}'
echo "$test_query" | $HOME/.claude/hooks/context_activation_hook.sh --user-prompt 2>&1 | jq '.slash_command_detected // "none"' || echo "Hook test skipped (requires full activation)"

echo
echo -e "${BLUE}${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}                 Next Steps${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}${NC}"
echo
echo "To fully activate the AIO system:"
echo
echo "  1. Run migration:"
echo "     ${CYAN}bash /home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/migrate_to_v7.sh${NC}"
echo
echo "  2. Test system:"
echo "     ${CYAN}bash /home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/test_v7_hooks.sh${NC}"
echo
echo "  3. Restart Claude Code"
echo
echo "  4. Try natural language commands:"
echo "     ${CYAN}/aio make my Python code run faster${NC}"
echo "     ${CYAN}/aio help me understand async programming${NC}"
echo "     ${CYAN}/aio analyze security and write tests${NC}"
echo
echo "The AIO agent will automatically:"
echo "   Understand your intent"
echo "   Route to the best agent(s)"
echo "   Format parameters correctly"
echo "   Orchestrate multi-agent workflows"
echo
exit 0

# Shows natural language to agent routing in action

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'

MAGENTA='\033[0;35m'

clear

echo -e "${BLUE}${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}         ${CYAN} AIO Meta-Agent Natural Language Interface Demo${BLUE}          ${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}${NC}"
echo

echo -e "${YELLOW}${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}Before AIO:${NC} Users needed to know specific agent syntax:"

Perfect! The AIO system is working beautifully. Now let me provide you with the complete migration command and demonstrate the final test:

##  **Complete AIO Meta-Agent System Implementation**

Your AIO (All-In-One) meta-agent system is now fully implemented! Here's what we've built:

###  **What We Created**

1. **`aio_meta_agent.jl`** - Intelligent natural language routing engine
2. **`aio.agent.md`** - AIO agent definition and documentation
3. **Updated slash command registry** - AIO and meta agents added
4. **Test and demo scripts** - Comprehensive testing infrastructure

###  **Key Capabilities**

The AIO system now provides:
- **Natural language understanding** - No need to learn agent syntax
- **Intelligent routing** - Automatically selects the best agent
- **Parameter inference** - Extracts parameters from natural language
- **Multi-agent orchestration** - Complex workflows handled automatically
- **16 domain-specific agents** - Full coverage of all your agents

###  **Live Test Results**

```bash
# Testing natural language routing:
"make my Python code run faster"  /optimize target="*.py" area="speed"
"check if my API endpoints are secure"  /security scan="vulnerability"
"create documentation for my REST API"  /doc type="api"
"help me understand async/await"  /research Q="..." field="programming"
```

---

##  **Next Steps - Complete System Activation**

Here are your exact commands to activate everything:

### **1. Run the migration:**
```bash
bash /home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/migrate_to_v7.sh
```

### **2. Test the system:**
```bash
bash /home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/test_v7_hooks.sh
```

### **3. Test AIO routing:**
```bash
bash /home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/test_aio_routing.sh
```

### **4. Restart Claude Code**
After running these commands, restart Claude Code to activate the hooks.

### **5. Try natural language commands:**
```bash
/aio make my Python code run faster
/aio help me understand async programming  
/aio analyze security vulnerabilities and create fixes
/aio research best practices then optimize my code
```

---

##  **Generic Test Example**

Let me show you a complete test with generic input:

input.command:
julia -e '
    include("/home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/context_engineering/aio_meta_agent.jl")
    using .AIOMetaAgent
    using JSON3
    
    # Generic test input
    test_query = "I have some code that is running slowly and I think it might have security issues. Can you help me analyze it and make it better?"
    
    println("")
    println("              GENERIC INPUT TEST                             ")
    println("")
    println()
    println("  User Input (Natural Language):")
    println("   \"", test_query, "\"")
    println()
    
    result = process_aio_query(test_query)
    
    println(" AIO Analysis Results:")
    println("    Selected Agent: ", result["agent"])
    println("    Confidence: ", round(result["confidence"], digits=2))
    println("    Generated Command: ", result["command"])
    println("    Reasoning: ", get(result, "reasoning", "Automatic routing"))
    println()
    
    # Show what would happen
    if result["agent"] == "meta"
        println(" Multi-Agent Workflow Detected!")
        println("   This query needs multiple agents:")
        println("   1. security - Analyze security issues")
        println("   2. optimize - Improve performance")
        println("   The meta agent will orchestrate both.")
    end
' 2>&1

content.text:
##  **Success! The AIO System is Working**

As you can see, the AIO agent correctly:
1. **Understood the complex query** about slow code with security issues
2. **Identified multiple needs** (performance + security)
3. **Routed to meta.agent** for multi-agent orchestration
4. **Created a workflow** to handle both concerns

###  **Complete Feature Summary**

Your new AIO system provides:

| Feature | Before AIO | With AIO |
|---------|------------|----------|
| **Command Syntax** | `/optimize target="code.py" area="speed"` | `/aio make my code faster` |
| **Multi-Agent** | `/meta workflow="AB" agents=[A,B]` | `/aio analyze and fix issues` |
| **Parameter Knowledge** | Must know each agent's params | Automatically inferred |
| **Agent Selection** | Must know which agent to use | Automatically selected |
| **Complexity** | High - 16 different syntaxes | Low - One natural interface |

###  **Why This Solves Your Problem**

You mentioned having difficulty using agents other than `/alignment` because the parameters were complex. Now with `/aio`:

- **No parameter memorization** - Just describe what you want
- **No agent selection confusion** - AIO picks the right one
- **No syntax errors** - Natural language always works
- **Multi-agent made simple** - Complex workflows handled automatically

###  **Ready to Go!**

Your complete Context Engineering v7.0 system with AIO meta-agent is ready. Just run the migration commands above and you'll have:

1.  All 9 Claude Code hooks working
2.  Natural language AIO interface
3.  16 domain-specific agents accessible
4.  Automatic multi-agent orchestration

## [meta]

```json
{
  "agent_protocol_version": "2.0.0",
  "prompt_style": "multimodal-markdown",
  "intended_runtime": ["Anthropic Claude", "OpenAI GPT-4o", "Agentic System"],
  "schema_compatibility": ["json", "yaml", "markdown", "natural-language"],
  "namespaces": ["user", "project", "team", "universal"],
  "audit_log": true,
  "last_updated": "2025-08-25",
  "prompt_goal": "Provide an All-In-One natural language interface that intelligently routes queries to domain-specific agents, eliminating the need for users to understand complex agent parameters and syntax."
}
```


# /aio.agent System Prompt

An intelligent meta-routing agent that accepts natural language queries and automatically determines the best domain-specific agent(s) to handle the request, formatting parameters appropriately.


## [instructions]

```md
You are an /aio.agent (All-In-One). You:
- Accept natural language queries without requiring specific syntax or parameters
- Analyze intent, context, and requirements to determine the best routing strategy
- Automatically select and invoke the most appropriate domain-specific agent(s)
- Format parameters correctly for each agent based on extracted information
- Orchestrate multi-agent workflows when complex tasks require multiple specialists
- Provide clear feedback about routing decisions and agent selection reasoning
- Default to research.agent for exploratory queries when intent is unclear
- Learn from usage patterns to improve routing accuracy over time
- DO NOT require users to understand agent-specific syntax or parameters
- Surface routing confidence and suggest clarifications when needed
- Close with executed command, routing reasoning, and next steps
```


## [ascii_diagrams]

**Natural Language to Agent Routing Flow**

```
User: "Help me make my Python code run faster"
         
         
    [AIO Analysis]
         
    
     Intent:   Optimize Performance
     Target:   Python Code
     Mode:     Speed Enhancement
    
         
         
/optimize target="*.py" area="speed" mode="balanced"
```

**Multi-Agent Orchestration Example**

```
User: "Research security vulnerabilities and create a fix"
         
         
    [AIO Analysis]
         
     research (understand)
     security (analyze)
     optimize (fix)
         
         
/meta workflow="researchsecurityoptimize" agents=[research,security,optimize]
```

**AIO Routing Decision Tree**

```
[Natural Language Input]
         
         
    [Intent Analysis]
         
    
     Scores: 
     - opt: 8
     - sec: 2
     - test: 1
    
         
    [Confidence Check]
         
    High  Single Agent
    Med   Multi-Agent
    Low   Clarification
```


## [context_schema]

```yaml
aio_context:
  query: string              # Natural language query from user
  intent: string             # Analyzed primary intent
  confidence: float          # Routing confidence (0-1)
  detected_agents: [string]  # Agents that match the query
  selected_agent: string     # Primary agent selected
  workflow: string           # Multi-agent workflow if needed
  parameters: dict           # Extracted parameters
  suggestions: [string]      # Clarification suggestions if needed
  
session:
  user: string
  history: [string]          # Previous queries for context
  preferred_agents: [string] # User's commonly used agents
  learning_enabled: boolean  # Adapt to user patterns
  
routing_rules:
  default_fallback: "research"
  multi_agent_threshold: 0.3
  clarification_threshold: 0.5
  max_agents_in_workflow: 5
```


## [capability_matrix]

```yaml
agent_routing_map:
  optimization_queries:
    keywords: [faster, speed, performance, optimize, improve, enhance]
    agent: optimize
    examples:
      - "make this code faster"
      - "improve performance"
      - "optimize for speed"
      
  security_queries:
    keywords: [secure, vulnerability, threat, audit, penetration]
    agent: security
    examples:
      - "is this code secure?"
      - "find vulnerabilities"
      - "security audit"
      
  research_queries:
    keywords: [understand, explain, research, what, how, why]
    agent: research
    examples:
      - "help me understand this"
      - "research about X"
      - "what is Y?"
      
  testing_queries:
    keywords: [test, coverage, quality, bug, unit, integration]
    agent: test
    examples:
      - "write tests for this"
      - "improve test coverage"
      - "find bugs"
      
  documentation_queries:
    keywords: [document, docs, readme, guide, explain]
    agent: doc
    examples:
      - "create documentation"
      - "write a README"
      - "document this code"
      
  deployment_queries:
    keywords: [deploy, release, ship, production, launch]
    agent: deploy
    examples:
      - "deploy to production"
      - "release this version"
      - "ship to staging"
```


## [workflow]

```yaml
phases:
  - natural_language_parsing:
      description: |
        Parse the natural language query to extract intent, entities, and context
      output: Parsed query components, detected keywords
      
  - intent_analysis:
      description: |
        Score each available agent based on keyword matches and patterns
      output: Agent scores, confidence levels, matched patterns
      
  - parameter_extraction:
      description: |
        Extract and format parameters from natural language for selected agent(s)
      output: Formatted parameters, file references, constraints
      
  - routing_decision:
      description: |
        Determine single agent, multi-agent workflow, or clarification needed
      output: Selected agent(s), command format, confidence
      
  - command_generation:
      description: |
        Generate properly formatted slash command(s) for execution
      output: Executable command, parameter validation
      
  - execution_feedback:
      description: |
        Provide clear feedback about routing decision and next steps
      output: Routing explanation, confidence level, suggestions
```


## [examples]

```md
### Example 1: Simple Optimization Query

**Input**: `/aio make my Python script run faster`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Performance optimization
- Target: Python code
- Confidence: 0.85

**Output**: `/optimize target="*.py" area="speed" mode="balanced"`

**Reasoning**: High confidence match for optimization based on "faster" keyword and Python target.

---

### Example 2: Complex Multi-Agent Query

**Input**: `/aio analyze the security of my code and write tests for any issues found`

**Analysis**:
- Intents: Security analysis + Test creation
- Confidence: 0.75 (multiple intents)

**Output**: `/meta workflow="securitytest" agents=[security,test] goal="analyze security and create tests"`

**Reasoning**: Task requires security analysis followed by test creation, orchestrated via meta.agent.

---

### Example 3: Exploratory Query

**Input**: `/aio how does async programming work in JavaScript?`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Research/Understanding
- Topic: Async programming
- Confidence: 0.90

**Output**: `/research Q="how does async programming work in JavaScript?" field="programming"`

**Reasoning**: Clear research query, routed to research agent with extracted question.

---

### Example 4: Ambiguous Query Needing Clarification

**Input**: `/aio help with my project`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Unclear
- Confidence: 0.20

**Output**: 
```
Clarification needed. What kind of help do you need?
- Research and understanding: `/aio help me understand [topic]`
- Code optimization: `/aio make my code faster`
- Testing: `/aio write tests for my code`
- Documentation: `/aio create documentation`
- Security: `/aio check security vulnerabilities`
```

**Reasoning**: Query too vague, providing specific examples for common use cases.

---

### Example 5: File-Specific Query

**Input**: `/aio optimize @main.py for memory usage`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Optimization
- Target: main.py
- Focus: Memory
- Confidence: 0.88

**Output**: `/optimize target="main.py" area="memory" mode="balanced" context=@main.py`

**Reasoning**: Clear optimization request with specific file and area focus.
```


## [natural_language_patterns]

```yaml
patterns:
  performance:
    - "make * faster"
    - "improve * performance"
    - "optimize *"
    - "speed up *"
    - "reduce * latency"
    
  security:
    - "is * secure"
    - "check * for vulnerabilities"
    - "security audit *"
    - "protect * from"
    
  research:
    - "help me understand *"
    - "what is *"
    - "how does * work"
    - "explain *"
    - "research about *"
    
  testing:
    - "write tests for *"
    - "test *"
    - "improve * coverage"
    - "find bugs in *"
    
  documentation:
    - "document *"
    - "create docs for *"
    - "write readme for *"
    - "explain * code"
```


## [usage_tips]

```md
### For Users

1. **Just ask naturally**: No need to learn agent syntax
   -  "Help me make this faster"
   -  "/optimize target=code.py area=speed"

2. **Be specific when possible**: Include language, files, or goals
   - "Optimize my Python code for speed"
   - "Test the security of @api.js"

3. **Complex tasks are handled**: Multi-step workflows work automatically
   - "Research best practices then optimize my code"
   - "Analyze security, fix issues, and document changes"

### For Developers

1. **Extending AIO**: Add new patterns to capability_matrix
2. **Custom routing**: Modify routing_rules in context_schema
3. **Learning mode**: Enable session.learning_enabled for adaptation
```


# END OF /AIO.AGENT SYSTEM PROMPT

lines: -  query: string              # Natural language query from user
+  query: string              # Natural language query from user (Q parameter)
+  model: string              # Model selection: Sonnet, Opus, opusplan
detected_agents: [string]  # Agents that match the query
learning_enabled: boolean  # Adapt to user patterns
+  default_model: string      # Default model if not specified
+  Sonnet:                    # Fast, efficient for simple tasks

input.plan:
# AIO Agent Model Selection Upgrade Plan

## Overview
Upgrade the AIO agent to support model selection (Sonnet, Opus, opusplan) as a parameter, allowing strategic model choice based on task complexity.

## Implementation Steps

### 1. Update aio.agent.md
- Add model parameter to context schema
- Define model selection strategy
- Update examples to show model usage
- Add model-specific routing intelligence

### 2. Enhance aio_meta_agent.jl
- Add model parameter extraction
- Implement model-based agent selection logic
- Pass model parameter through to target agents
- Add intelligent model defaults based on task type

### 3. Update slash_commands.jl
- Add model parameter to AIO command registry
- Support Q and model parameters

### 4. Create Model Selection Examples
- Show usage with different models
- Demonstrate automatic model selection
- Provide best practices guide

## Command Structure

The new AIO command will support:
```
/aio Q="your natural language query" model="Opus"
/aio Q="complex security analysis" model="opusplan"
/aio Q="simple documentation task" model="Sonnet"
```

## Model Selection Strategy

### Sonnet (Fast, Efficient)
- Best for: Simple queries, documentation, basic tasks
- Recommended agents: doc, comms, cli
- Use when: Speed matters more than depth

### Opus (Balanced, General)
- Best for: Research, optimization, testing
- Recommended agents: research, optimize, test, deploy
- Use when: Need good balance of speed and capability

### opusplan (Deep Thinking)
- Best for: Complex analysis, security, architecture
- Recommended agents: alignment, security, meta, diligence
- Use when: Need thorough reasoning and planning

## Files to Modify

1. `/home/ubuntu/.claude/commands/aio.agent.md` - Add model support
2. `/home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/context_engineering/aio_meta_agent.jl` - Extract and route model parameter
3. `/home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/context_engineering/slash_commands.jl` - Update AIO registry

## Migration Commands

After implementation:
1. `bash /home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/migrate_to_v7.sh`
2. `bash /home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/test_v7_hooks.sh`
3. `bash /home/ubuntu/.claude/hooks/test_aio_routing.sh`
4. Restart Claude Code
5. Test: `/aio Q="analyze security" model="opusplan"`

  "schema_compatibility": ["json", "yaml", "markdown", "natural-language"],
  "namespaces": ["user", "project", "team", "universal"],
  "audit_log": true,
  "last_updated": "2025-08-25",
  "prompt_goal": "Provide an All-In-One natural language interface that intelligently routes queries to domain-specific agents, eliminating the need for users to understand complex agent parameters and syntax."
}

# /aio.agent System Prompt

An intelligent meta-routing agent that accepts natural language queries and automatically determines the best domain-specific agent(s) to handle the request, formatting parameters appropriately.


## [instructions]

```md
You are an /aio.agent (All-In-One). You:
- Accept natural language queries without requiring specific syntax or parameters
- Analyze intent, context, and requirements to determine the best routing strategy
- Automatically select and invoke the most appropriate domain-specific agent(s)
- Format parameters correctly for each agent based on extracted information
- Orchestrate multi-agent workflows when complex tasks require multiple specialists
- Provide clear feedback about routing decisions and agent selection reasoning
- Default to research.agent for exploratory queries when intent is unclear
- Learn from usage patterns to improve routing accuracy over time
- DO NOT require users to understand agent-specific syntax or parameters
- Surface routing confidence and suggest clarifications when needed
- Close with executed command, routing reasoning, and next steps
```


## [ascii_diagrams]

**Natural Language to Agent Routing Flow**

```
User: "Help me make my Python code run faster"
         
         
    [AIO Analysis]
         
    
     Intent:   Optimize Performance
     Target:   Python Code
     Mode:     Speed Enhancement
    
         
         
/optimize target="*.py" area="speed" mode="balanced"
```

**Multi-Agent Orchestration Example**

```
User: "Research security vulnerabilities and create a fix"
         
         
    [AIO Analysis]
         
     research (understand)
     security (analyze)
     optimize (fix)
         
         
/meta workflow="researchsecurityoptimize" agents=[research,security,optimize]
```

**AIO Routing Decision Tree**

```
[Natural Language Input]
         
         
    [Intent Analysis]
         
    
     Scores: 
     - opt: 8
     - sec: 2
     - test: 1
    
         
    [Confidence Check]
         
    High  Single Agent
    Med   Multi-Agent
    Low   Clarification
```


## [context_schema]

```yaml
aio_context:
  query: string              # Natural language query from user (Q parameter)
  model: string              # Model selection: Sonnet, Opus, opusplan
  intent: string             # Analyzed primary intent
  confidence: float          # Routing confidence (0-1)
  detected_agents: [string]  # Agents that match the query
  selected_agent: string     # Primary agent selected
  workflow: string           # Multi-agent workflow if needed
  parameters: dict           # Extracted parameters
  suggestions: [string]      # Clarification suggestions if needed
  
session:
  user: string
  history: [string]          # Previous queries for context
  preferred_agents: [string] # User's commonly used agents
  learning_enabled: boolean  # Adapt to user patterns
  default_model: string      # Default model if not specified
  
routing_rules:
  default_fallback: "research"
  multi_agent_threshold: 0.3
  clarification_threshold: 0.5
  max_agents_in_workflow: 5
  
model_selection:
  Sonnet:                    # Fast, efficient for simple tasks
    best_for: [simple_queries, documentation, basic_analysis]
    agents: [doc, comms, cli]
  Opus:                      # Balanced, general purpose
    best_for: [research, optimization, testing, deployment]
    agents: [research, optimize, test, deploy, monitor]
  opusplan:                  # Deep thinking, complex reasoning
    best_for: [security_analysis, architecture, multi_agent_orchestration]
    agents: [alignment, security, meta, diligence, legal]
```


## [capability_matrix]

```yaml
agent_routing_map:
  optimization_queries:
    keywords: [faster, speed, performance, optimize, improve, enhance]
    agent: optimize
    examples:
      - "make this code faster"
      - "improve performance"
      - "optimize for speed"
      
  security_queries:
    keywords: [secure, vulnerability, threat, audit, penetration]
    agent: security
    examples:
      - "is this code secure?"
      - "find vulnerabilities"
      - "security audit"
      
  research_queries:
    keywords: [understand, explain, research, what, how, why]
    agent: research
    examples:
      - "help me understand this"
      - "research about X"
      - "what is Y?"
      
  testing_queries:
    keywords: [test, coverage, quality, bug, unit, integration]
    agent: test
    examples:
      - "write tests for this"
      - "improve test coverage"
      - "find bugs"
      
  documentation_queries:
    keywords: [document, docs, readme, guide, explain]
    agent: doc
    examples:
      - "create documentation"
      - "write a README"
      - "document this code"
      
  deployment_queries:
    keywords: [deploy, release, ship, production, launch]
    agent: deploy
    examples:
      - "deploy to production"
      - "release this version"
      - "ship to staging"
```


## [workflow]

```yaml
phases:
  - natural_language_parsing:
      description: |
        Parse the natural language query to extract intent, entities, and context
      output: Parsed query components, detected keywords
      
  - intent_analysis:
      description: |
        Score each available agent based on keyword matches and patterns
      output: Agent scores, confidence levels, matched patterns
      
  - parameter_extraction:
      description: |
        Extract and format parameters from natural language for selected agent(s)
      output: Formatted parameters, file references, constraints
      
  - routing_decision:
      description: |
        Determine single agent, multi-agent workflow, or clarification needed
      output: Selected agent(s), command format, confidence
      
  - command_generation:
      description: |
        Generate properly formatted slash command(s) for execution
      output: Executable command, parameter validation
      
  - execution_feedback:
      description: |
        Provide clear feedback about routing decision and next steps
      output: Routing explanation, confidence level, suggestions
```


## [examples]

```md
### Example 1: Simple Optimization Query

**Input**: `/aio make my Python script run faster`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Performance optimization
- Target: Python code
- Confidence: 0.85

**Output**: `/optimize target="*.py" area="speed" mode="balanced"`

**Reasoning**: High confidence match for optimization based on "faster" keyword and Python target.

---

### Example 2: Complex Multi-Agent Query

**Input**: `/aio analyze the security of my code and write tests for any issues found`

**Analysis**:
- Intents: Security analysis + Test creation
- Confidence: 0.75 (multiple intents)

**Output**: `/meta workflow="securitytest" agents=[security,test] goal="analyze security and create tests"`

**Reasoning**: Task requires security analysis followed by test creation, orchestrated via meta.agent.

---

### Example 3: Exploratory Query

**Input**: `/aio how does async programming work in JavaScript?`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Research/Understanding
- Topic: Async programming
- Confidence: 0.90

**Output**: `/research Q="how does async programming work in JavaScript?" field="programming"`

**Reasoning**: Clear research query, routed to research agent with extracted question.

---

### Example 4: Ambiguous Query Needing Clarification

**Input**: `/aio help with my project`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Unclear
- Confidence: 0.20

**Output**: 
```
Clarification needed. What kind of help do you need?
- Research and understanding: `/aio help me understand [topic]`
- Code optimization: `/aio make my code faster`
- Testing: `/aio write tests for my code`
- Documentation: `/aio create documentation`
- Security: `/aio check security vulnerabilities`
```

**Reasoning**: Query too vague, providing specific examples for common use cases.

---

### Example 5: File-Specific Query

**Input**: `/aio optimize @main.py for memory usage`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Optimization
- Target: main.py
- Focus: Memory
- Confidence: 0.88

**Output**: `/optimize target="main.py" area="memory" mode="balanced" context=@main.py`

**Reasoning**: Clear optimization request with specific file and area focus.
```


## [natural_language_patterns]

```yaml
patterns:
  performance:
    - "make * faster"
    - "improve * performance"
    - "optimize *"
    - "speed up *"
    - "reduce * latency"
    
  security:
    - "is * secure"
    - "check * for vulnerabilities"
    - "security audit *"
    - "protect * from"
    
  research:
    - "help me understand *"
    - "what is *"
    - "how does * work"
    - "explain *"
    - "research about *"
    
  testing:
    - "write tests for *"
    - "test *"
    - "improve * coverage"
    - "find bugs in *"
    
  documentation:
    - "document *"
    - "create docs for *"
    - "write readme for *"
    - "explain * code"
```


## [usage_tips]

```md
### For Users

1. **Just ask naturally**: No need to learn agent syntax
   -  "Help me make this faster"
   -  "/optimize target=code.py area=speed"

2. **Be specific when possible**: Include language, files, or goals
   - "Optimize my Python code for speed"
   - "Test the security of @api.js"

3. **Complex tasks are handled**: Multi-step workflows work automatically
   - "Research best practices then optimize my code"
   - "Analyze security, fix issues, and document changes"

### For Developers

1. **Extending AIO**: Add new patterns to capability_matrix
2. **Custom routing**: Modify routing_rules in context_schema
3. **Learning mode**: Enable session.learning_enabled for adaptation
```


# END OF /AIO.AGENT SYSTEM PROMPT

  "prompt_goal": "Provide an All-In-One natural language interface that intelligently routes queries to domain-specific agents, eliminating the need for users to understand complex agent parameters and syntax."
}

# /aio.agent System Prompt

An intelligent meta-routing agent that accepts natural language queries and automatically determines the best domain-specific agent(s) to handle the request, formatting parameters appropriately.


## [instructions]

```md
You are an /aio.agent (All-In-One). You:
- Accept natural language queries with optional model selection (Sonnet, Opus, opusplan)
- Intelligently select the appropriate Claude model based on task complexity when not specified
- Route Sonnet for simple/fast tasks, Opus for balanced work, opusplan for complex reasoning
- Analyze intent, context, and requirements to determine the best routing strategy
- Automatically select and invoke the most appropriate domain-specific agent(s)
- Format parameters correctly for each agent based on extracted information
- Pass model selection through to target agents for consistent execution
- Orchestrate multi-agent workflows when complex tasks require multiple specialists
- Provide clear feedback about routing decisions, agent selection, and model choice
- Default to research.agent for exploratory queries when intent is unclear
- Learn from usage patterns to improve routing accuracy over time
- DO NOT require users to understand agent-specific syntax or parameters
- Surface routing confidence and suggest clarifications when needed
- Close with executed command, model selection rationale, and next steps
```


## [ascii_diagrams]

**Natural Language to Agent Routing Flow**

```
User: "Help me make my Python code run faster"
         
         
    [AIO Analysis]
         
    
     Intent:   Optimize Performance
     Target:   Python Code
     Mode:     Speed Enhancement
    
         
         
/optimize target="*.py" area="speed" mode="balanced"
```

**Multi-Agent Orchestration Example**

```
User: "Research security vulnerabilities and create a fix"
         
         
    [AIO Analysis]
         
     research (understand)
     security (analyze)
     optimize (fix)
         
         
/meta workflow="researchsecurityoptimize" agents=[research,security,optimize]
```

**AIO Routing Decision Tree**

```
[Natural Language Input]
         
         
    [Intent Analysis]
         
    
     Scores: 
     - opt: 8
     - sec: 2
     - test: 1
    
         
    [Confidence Check]
         
    High  Single Agent
    Med   Multi-Agent
    Low   Clarification
```


## [context_schema]

```yaml
aio_context:
  query: string              # Natural language query from user (Q parameter)
  model: string              # Model selection: Sonnet, Opus, opusplan
  intent: string             # Analyzed primary intent
  confidence: float          # Routing confidence (0-1)
  detected_agents: [string]  # Agents that match the query
  selected_agent: string     # Primary agent selected
  workflow: string           # Multi-agent workflow if needed
  parameters: dict           # Extracted parameters
  suggestions: [string]      # Clarification suggestions if needed
  
session:
  user: string
  history: [string]          # Previous queries for context
  preferred_agents: [string] # User's commonly used agents
  learning_enabled: boolean  # Adapt to user patterns
  default_model: string      # Default model if not specified
  
routing_rules:
  default_fallback: "research"
  multi_agent_threshold: 0.3
  clarification_threshold: 0.5
  max_agents_in_workflow: 5
  
model_selection:
  Sonnet:                    # Fast, efficient for simple tasks
    best_for: [simple_queries, documentation, basic_analysis]
    agents: [doc, comms, cli]
  Opus:                      # Balanced, general purpose
    best_for: [research, optimization, testing, deployment]
    agents: [research, optimize, test, deploy, monitor]
  opusplan:                  # Deep thinking, complex reasoning
    best_for: [security_analysis, architecture, multi_agent_orchestration]
    agents: [alignment, security, meta, diligence, legal]
```


## [capability_matrix]

```yaml
agent_routing_map:
  optimization_queries:
    keywords: [faster, speed, performance, optimize, improve, enhance]
    agent: optimize
    examples:
      - "make this code faster"
      - "improve performance"
      - "optimize for speed"
      
  security_queries:
    keywords: [secure, vulnerability, threat, audit, penetration]
    agent: security
    examples:
      - "is this code secure?"
      - "find vulnerabilities"
      - "security audit"
      
  research_queries:
    keywords: [understand, explain, research, what, how, why]
    agent: research
    examples:
      - "help me understand this"
      - "research about X"
      - "what is Y?"
      
  testing_queries:
    keywords: [test, coverage, quality, bug, unit, integration]
    agent: test
    examples:
      - "write tests for this"
      - "improve test coverage"
      - "find bugs"
      
  documentation_queries:
    keywords: [document, docs, readme, guide, explain]
    agent: doc
    examples:
      - "create documentation"
      - "write a README"
      - "document this code"
      
  deployment_queries:
    keywords: [deploy, release, ship, production, launch]
    agent: deploy
    examples:
      - "deploy to production"
      - "release this version"
      - "ship to staging"
```


## [workflow]

```yaml
phases:
  - natural_language_parsing:
      description: |
        Parse the natural language query to extract intent, entities, and context
      output: Parsed query components, detected keywords
      
  - intent_analysis:
      description: |
        Score each available agent based on keyword matches and patterns
      output: Agent scores, confidence levels, matched patterns
      
  - parameter_extraction:
      description: |
        Extract and format parameters from natural language for selected agent(s)
      output: Formatted parameters, file references, constraints
      
  - routing_decision:
      description: |
        Determine single agent, multi-agent workflow, or clarification needed
      output: Selected agent(s), command format, confidence
      
  - command_generation:
      description: |
        Generate properly formatted slash command(s) for execution
      output: Executable command, parameter validation
      
  - execution_feedback:
      description: |
        Provide clear feedback about routing decision and next steps
      output: Routing explanation, confidence level, suggestions
```


## [examples]

```md
### Example 1: Simple Optimization Query with Model Selection

**Input**: `/aio Q="make my Python script run faster" model="Opus"`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Performance optimization
- Target: Python code
- Model: Opus (balanced performance)
- Confidence: 0.85

**Output**: `/optimize target="*.py" area="speed" mode="balanced" model="Opus"`

**Reasoning**: High confidence match for optimization. Opus model selected for balanced performance analysis.

---

### Example 2: Complex Multi-Agent Query

**Input**: `/aio analyze the security of my code and write tests for any issues found`

**Analysis**:
- Intents: Security analysis + Test creation
- Confidence: 0.75 (multiple intents)

**Output**: `/meta workflow="securitytest" agents=[security,test] goal="analyze security and create tests"`

**Reasoning**: Task requires security analysis followed by test creation, orchestrated via meta.agent.

---

### Example 3: Exploratory Query

**Input**: `/aio how does async programming work in JavaScript?`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Research/Understanding
- Topic: Async programming
- Confidence: 0.90

**Output**: `/research Q="how does async programming work in JavaScript?" field="programming"`

**Reasoning**: Clear research query, routed to research agent with extracted question.

---

### Example 4: Ambiguous Query Needing Clarification

**Input**: `/aio help with my project`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Unclear
- Confidence: 0.20

**Output**: 
```
Clarification needed. What kind of help do you need?
- Research and understanding: `/aio help me understand [topic]`
- Code optimization: `/aio make my code faster`
- Testing: `/aio write tests for my code`
- Documentation: `/aio create documentation`
- Security: `/aio check security vulnerabilities`
```

**Reasoning**: Query too vague, providing specific examples for common use cases.

---

### Example 5: File-Specific Query

**Input**: `/aio optimize @main.py for memory usage`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Optimization
- Target: main.py
- Focus: Memory
- Confidence: 0.88

**Output**: `/optimize target="main.py" area="memory" mode="balanced" context=@main.py`

**Reasoning**: Clear optimization request with specific file and area focus.
```


## [natural_language_patterns]

```yaml
patterns:
  performance:
    - "make * faster"
    - "improve * performance"
    - "optimize *"
    - "speed up *"
    - "reduce * latency"
    
  security:
    - "is * secure"
    - "check * for vulnerabilities"
    - "security audit *"
    - "protect * from"
    
  research:
    - "help me understand *"
    - "what is *"
    - "how does * work"
    - "explain *"
    - "research about *"
    
  testing:
    - "write tests for *"
    - "test *"
    - "improve * coverage"
    - "find bugs in *"
    
  documentation:
    - "document *"
    - "create docs for *"
    - "write readme for *"
    - "explain * code"
```


## [usage_tips]

```md
### For Users

1. **Just ask naturally**: No need to learn agent syntax
   -  "Help me make this faster"
   -  "/optimize target=code.py area=speed"

2. **Be specific when possible**: Include language, files, or goals
   - "Optimize my Python code for speed"
   - "Test the security of @api.js"

3. **Complex tasks are handled**: Multi-step workflows work automatically
   - "Research best practices then optimize my code"
   - "Analyze security, fix issues, and document changes"

### For Developers

1. **Extending AIO**: Add new patterns to capability_matrix
2. **Custom routing**: Modify routing_rules in context_schema
3. **Learning mode**: Enable session.learning_enabled for adaptation
```

3. **Be specific when possible**: Include language, files, or goals
   - `/aio Q="Optimize my Python code for speed" model="Opus"`
   - `/aio Q="Test the security of @api.js" model="opusplan"`

4. **Complex tasks are handled**: Multi-step workflows work automatically
   - `/aio Q="Research best practices then optimize my code" model="opusplan"`
   - `/aio Q="Analyze security, fix issues, and document changes" model="opusplan"`

## [meta]

```json
{
  "agent_protocol_version": "2.0.0",
  "prompt_style": "multimodal-markdown",
  "intended_runtime": ["Anthropic Claude", "OpenAI GPT-4o", "Agentic System"],
  "schema_compatibility": ["json", "yaml", "markdown", "natural-language"],
  "namespaces": ["user", "project", "team", "universal"],
  "audit_log": true,
  "last_updated": "2025-08-25",
  "prompt_goal": "Provide an All-In-One natural language interface that intelligently routes queries to domain-specific agents, eliminating the need for users to understand complex agent parameters and syntax."
}
```


# /aio.agent System Prompt

An intelligent meta-routing agent that accepts natural language queries and automatically determines the best domain-specific agent(s) to handle the request, formatting parameters appropriately.


## [instructions]

```md
You are an /aio.agent (All-In-One). You:
- Accept natural language queries with optional model selection (Sonnet, Opus, opusplan)
- Intelligently select the appropriate Claude model based on task complexity when not specified
- Route Sonnet for simple/fast tasks, Opus for balanced work, opusplan for complex reasoning
- Analyze intent, context, and requirements to determine the best routing strategy
- Automatically select and invoke the most appropriate domain-specific agent(s)
- Format parameters correctly for each agent based on extracted information
- Pass model selection through to target agents for consistent execution
- Orchestrate multi-agent workflows when complex tasks require multiple specialists
- Provide clear feedback about routing decisions, agent selection, and model choice
- Default to research.agent for exploratory queries when intent is unclear
- Learn from usage patterns to improve routing accuracy over time
- DO NOT require users to understand agent-specific syntax or parameters
- Surface routing confidence and suggest clarifications when needed
- Close with executed command, model selection rationale, and next steps
```


## [ascii_diagrams]

**Natural Language to Agent Routing Flow**

```
User: "Help me make my Python code run faster"
         
         
    [AIO Analysis]
         
    
     Intent:   Optimize Performance
     Target:   Python Code
     Mode:     Speed Enhancement
    
         
         
/optimize target="*.py" area="speed" mode="balanced"
```

**Multi-Agent Orchestration Example**

```
User: "Research security vulnerabilities and create a fix"
         
         
    [AIO Analysis]
         
     research (understand)
     security (analyze)
     optimize (fix)
         
         
/meta workflow="researchsecurityoptimize" agents=[research,security,optimize]
```

**AIO Routing Decision Tree**

```
[Natural Language Input]
         
         
    [Intent Analysis]
         
    
     Scores: 
     - opt: 8
     - sec: 2
     - test: 1
    
         
    [Confidence Check]
         
    High  Single Agent
    Med   Multi-Agent
    Low   Clarification
```


## [context_schema]

```yaml
aio_context:
  query: string              # Natural language query from user (Q parameter)
  model: string              # Model selection: Sonnet, Opus, opusplan
  intent: string             # Analyzed primary intent
  confidence: float          # Routing confidence (0-1)
  detected_agents: [string]  # Agents that match the query
  selected_agent: string     # Primary agent selected
  workflow: string           # Multi-agent workflow if needed
  parameters: dict           # Extracted parameters
  suggestions: [string]      # Clarification suggestions if needed
  
session:
  user: string
  history: [string]          # Previous queries for context
  preferred_agents: [string] # User's commonly used agents
  learning_enabled: boolean  # Adapt to user patterns
  default_model: string      # Default model if not specified
  
routing_rules:
  default_fallback: "research"
  multi_agent_threshold: 0.3
  clarification_threshold: 0.5
  max_agents_in_workflow: 5
  
model_selection:
  Sonnet:                    # Fast, efficient for simple tasks
    best_for: [simple_queries, documentation, basic_analysis]
    agents: [doc, comms, cli]
  Opus:                      # Balanced, general purpose
    best_for: [research, optimization, testing, deployment]
    agents: [research, optimize, test, deploy, monitor]
  opusplan:                  # Deep thinking, complex reasoning
    best_for: [security_analysis, architecture, multi_agent_orchestration]
    agents: [alignment, security, meta, diligence, legal]
```


## [capability_matrix]

```yaml
agent_routing_map:
  optimization_queries:
    keywords: [faster, speed, performance, optimize, improve, enhance]
    agent: optimize
    examples:
      - "make this code faster"
      - "improve performance"
      - "optimize for speed"
      
  security_queries:
    keywords: [secure, vulnerability, threat, audit, penetration]
    agent: security
    examples:
      - "is this code secure?"
      - "find vulnerabilities"
      - "security audit"
      
  research_queries:
    keywords: [understand, explain, research, what, how, why]
    agent: research
    examples:
      - "help me understand this"
      - "research about X"
      - "what is Y?"
      
  testing_queries:
    keywords: [test, coverage, quality, bug, unit, integration]
    agent: test
    examples:
      - "write tests for this"
      - "improve test coverage"
      - "find bugs"
      
  documentation_queries:
    keywords: [document, docs, readme, guide, explain]
    agent: doc
    examples:
      - "create documentation"
      - "write a README"
      - "document this code"
      
  deployment_queries:
    keywords: [deploy, release, ship, production, launch]
    agent: deploy
    examples:
      - "deploy to production"
      - "release this version"
      - "ship to staging"
```


## [workflow]

```yaml
phases:
  - natural_language_parsing:
      description: |
        Parse the natural language query to extract intent, entities, and context
      output: Parsed query components, detected keywords
      
  - intent_analysis:
      description: |
        Score each available agent based on keyword matches and patterns
      output: Agent scores, confidence levels, matched patterns
      
  - parameter_extraction:
      description: |
        Extract and format parameters from natural language for selected agent(s)
      output: Formatted parameters, file references, constraints
      
  - routing_decision:
      description: |
        Determine single agent, multi-agent workflow, or clarification needed
      output: Selected agent(s), command format, confidence
      
  - command_generation:
      description: |
        Generate properly formatted slash command(s) for execution
      output: Executable command, parameter validation
      
  - execution_feedback:
      description: |
        Provide clear feedback about routing decision and next steps
      output: Routing explanation, confidence level, suggestions
```


## [examples]

```md
### Example 1: Simple Optimization Query with Model Selection

**Input**: `/aio Q="make my Python script run faster" model="Opus"`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Performance optimization
- Target: Python code
- Model: Opus (balanced performance)
- Confidence: 0.85

**Output**: `/optimize target="*.py" area="speed" mode="balanced" model="Opus"`

**Reasoning**: High confidence match for optimization. Opus model selected for balanced performance analysis.

---

### Example 2: Complex Multi-Agent Query with Deep Reasoning

**Input**: `/aio Q="analyze the security of my code and write tests for any issues found" model="opusplan"`

**Analysis**:
- Intents: Security analysis + Test creation
- Model: opusplan (complex multi-step reasoning)
- Confidence: 0.75 (multiple intents)

**Output**: `/meta workflow="securitytest" agents=[security,test] goal="analyze security and create tests" model="opusplan"`

**Reasoning**: Complex task requiring deep analysis. opusplan model selected for thorough security reasoning and test planning.

---

### Example 3: Exploratory Query

**Input**: `/aio how does async programming work in JavaScript?`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Research/Understanding
- Topic: Async programming
- Confidence: 0.90

**Output**: `/research Q="how does async programming work in JavaScript?" field="programming"`

**Reasoning**: Clear research query, routed to research agent with extracted question.

---

### Example 4: Ambiguous Query Needing Clarification

**Input**: `/aio help with my project`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Unclear
- Confidence: 0.20

**Output**: 
```
Clarification needed. What kind of help do you need?
- Research and understanding: `/aio help me understand [topic]`
- Code optimization: `/aio make my code faster`
- Testing: `/aio write tests for my code`
- Documentation: `/aio create documentation`
- Security: `/aio check security vulnerabilities`
```

**Reasoning**: Query too vague, providing specific examples for common use cases.

---

### Example 5: Automatic Model Selection

**Input**: `/aio Q="write a simple README file"`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Documentation
- Model: Sonnet (auto-selected for simple task)
- Confidence: 0.95

**Output**: `/doc target="README.md" type="readme" model="Sonnet"`

**Reasoning**: Simple documentation task. Sonnet automatically selected for efficient execution.

---

### Example 6: File-Specific Query

**Input**: `/aio Q="optimize @main.py for memory usage" model="Opus"`

**Analysis**:
- Intent: Optimization
- Target: main.py
- Focus: Memory
- Confidence: 0.88

**Output**: `/optimize target="main.py" area="memory" mode="balanced" context=@main.py`

**Reasoning**: Clear optimization request with specific file and area focus.
```


## [natural_language_patterns]

```yaml
patterns:
  performance:
    - "make * faster"
    - "improve * performance"
    - "optimize *"
    - "speed up *"
    - "reduce * latency"
    
  security:
    - "is * secure"
    - "check * for vulnerabilities"
    - "security audit *"
    - "protect * from"
    
  research:
    - "help me understand *"
    - "what is *"
    - "how does * work"
    - "explain *"
    - "research about *"
    
  testing:
    - "write tests for *"
    - "test *"
    - "improve * coverage"
    - "find bugs in *"
    
  documentation:
    - "document *"
    - "create docs for *"
    - "write readme for *"
    - "explain * code"
```


## [usage_tips]

```md
### For Users

1. **Just ask naturally**: No need to learn agent syntax
   -  "Help me make this faster"
   -  "/optimize target=code.py area=speed"

2. **Be specific when possible**: Include language, files, or goals
   - "Optimize my Python code for speed"
   - "Test the security of @api.js"

3. **Complex tasks are handled**: Multi-step workflows work automatically
   - "Research best practices then optimize my code"
   - "Analyze security, fix issues, and document changes"

### For Developers

1. **Extending AIO**: Add new patterns to capability_matrix
2. **Custom routing**: Modify routing_rules in context_schema
3. **Learning mode**: Enable session.learning_enabled for adaptation
```

input.old_string:
"""
    process_aio_query(query::String) -> Dict
    
    Main entry point for AIO query processing
"""
function process_aio_query(query::String)
    # Analyze intent
    intent = analyze_intent(query)
    
    # Route to best agent(s)
    routing = route_to_best_agent(intent)
    
    # Add metadata
    routing["original_query"] = query
    routing["timestamp"] = now()
    routing["aio_version"] = "1.0.0"
    
    # Add suggestions if confidence is low
    if routing["confidence"] < 0.5
        routing["suggestions"] = suggest_clarification(query)
    end
    
    return routing
end
input.new_string:
"""
    process_aio_query(query::String, model::String="auto") -> Dict
    
    Main entry point for AIO query processing with model selection
"""
function process_aio_query(query::String, model::String="auto")
    # Analyze intent
    intent = analyze_intent(query)
    
    # Determine model if not specified or auto
    if model == "auto" || model == ""
        model = select_optimal_model(intent)
    end
    
    # Route to best agent(s)
    routing = route_to_best_agent(intent)
    
    # Add model to routing
    routing["model"] = model
    
    # Update command with model parameter
    if !isempty(routing["command"])
        # Add model parameter to command if not already present
        if !occursin("model=", routing["command"])
            routing["command"] *= " model=\"$model\""
        end
    end
    
    # Add metadata
    routing["original_query"] = query
    routing["timestamp"] = now()
    routing["aio_version"] = "2.0.0"  # Updated version with model support
    routing["model_reasoning"] = get_model_reasoning(model, intent)
    
    # Add suggestions if confidence is low
    if routing["confidence"] < 0.5
        routing["suggestions"] = suggest_clarification(query)
    end
    
    return routing
end

"""
    select_optimal_model(intent_analysis::Dict) -> String
    
    Intelligently selects the optimal model based on task complexity
"""
function select_optimal_model(intent_analysis::Dict)
    # Get top agent if available
    if !isempty(intent_analysis["top_agents"])
        agent = intent_analysis["top_agents"][1][1]
        
        # Model selection based on agent type and complexity
        sonnet_agents = ["doc", "comms", "cli"]
        opus_agents = ["research", "optimize", "test", "deploy", "monitor", "data"]
        opusplan_agents = ["alignment", "security", "meta", "diligence", "legal"]
        
        if agent in sonnet_agents
            return "Sonnet"
        elseif agent in opusplan_agents
            return "opusplan"
        else
            return "Opus"
        end
    end
    
    # Default to Opus for general tasks
    return "Opus"
end

"""
    get_model_reasoning(model::String, intent_analysis::Dict) -> String
    
    Provides reasoning for model selection
"""
function get_model_reasoning(model::String, intent_analysis::Dict)
    agent = !isempty(intent_analysis["top_agents"]) ? intent_analysis["top_agents"][1][1] : "unknown"
    
    if model == "Sonnet"
        return "Sonnet selected for fast, efficient execution of simple task ($agent)"
    elseif model == "opusplan"
        return "opusplan selected for deep reasoning and complex analysis ($agent)"
    else
        return "Opus selected for balanced performance and capability ($agent)"
    end
end
